loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Sagrada Familia está trabajando en su ciclo número 6, en forma conjunta dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Son mujeres madres de familia que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Narcisa es parte de este grupo, y comenta que ella vende carbón, con este trabajo está saliendo adelante y genera sus ingresos. Cuenta que hoy en día el carbón es muy vendido porque es más económico, y que gracias a eso le está yendo muy bien en su negocio. Está contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que la ha ayudado mucho. Solicita de este crédito para poder usarlo en la compra de carbón, y así seguir con sus ventas y seguir también teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sagrada Familia (Holy Family) is on its sixth loan cycle, working together within the women entrepreneurs program. They are all mothers of families who are working to move forward and help their families through work. 

Narcisa is part of this group and she says that she sells charcoal. With this work, she is advancing and generating income. She says that now charcoal is sold a lot because it is very economical, and thanks to this, things are going well for her in her business. She is happy to be a part of this group, because it has helped her a lot. She is asking for this loan to buy charcoal. This way, she will continue with her sales and also continue having the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Las 13 mujeres del grupo sagrada familia se está esforzando al máximo por salir adelante, con su trabajo ya están en el ciclo 3 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y quieren seguir creciendo y trabajando juntas para llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Claudia es una de las miembros, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, y comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de productos como ser plásticos, cartones, papeles, aluminio y demás. Ella todos los días desde muy tempranas horas sale a recorrer en busca de esos productos y así sustenta a su familia. Ella está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, papeles, cartones, aluminio y demás, para poder revenderlos y de esa forma tener una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
The 13 women of the Sagrada Familia (Holy Family) group are striving to move forward. With their work, they are already in the 3rd cycle of the women entrepreneurs program, and they want to continue growing and working together to get to the highest level of the program.

Claudia is one of the members. She is a very hard-working and selfless person. She says that she works recycling products like plastics, cardboard, paper, aluminum, and more. Every day, starting very early, she leaves to look for these products and she supports her family this way. She is proud of what she does, because it is dignified and honest work. She is asking for the loan to buy plastic, paper, cardboard, aluminum, and more, to be able to resell them and have better profits this way.

loans.use: to buy plastic, paper, cardboard, aluminum, and more to be able to resell it.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora, de 63 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos,actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a dos nietos de 19 años y 11 años de edad respectivamente a quienes cría desde muy pequeños y es por ellos que se esfuerza a diario para seguir adelante.Flora se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Ella tiene una mesa en donde coloca diariamente todo tipo de golosinas como chocolates, galletas, caramelos, chicles y distintos bocaditos. Trabaja alrededor de un centro de esparcimiento muy concurrido por la población y afortunadamente siempre tiene buenas ventas en su horario de trabajo. Lleva en esta actividad más de 13 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus nietos . 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera y que le permite solventar las necesidades de sus nietos además se siente útil a la sociedad , aunque muchas veces ha querido dejar su trabajo por el cansancio que le ocasiona debido a su edad, siempre obtiene nuevas energías y continúa realizando su labor con mucho optimismo , además espera continuar vendiendo por el bien de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará más golosinas como caramelos, hojuelas de maíz, galletas , chicles, entre otros.
texts.en:
Flora, 63 years old, is a widow with five children. She currently lives in her own home with two grandchildren, who are 19 and 11 years old, respectively, and whom she has raised since they were very young. It is to help them get ahead that she works so hard every day selling all kinds of sweets, such as chocolates, cookies, candy, gum and various snacks. She works in the vicinity of a busy, well-attended recreation center and fortunately has always had good sales during her work schedule. She has run this business for over 13 years, sometimes with the help of her grandchildren.

What she enjoys about her business is that she is self-employed and can earn an income that enables her to support her grandchildren and to feel she is a useful member of society. However many times she has wanted to stop working due to fatigue stemming from her age. Nevertheless she always feels regenerated and continues to work with great optimism. She also hopes to keep working to insure her family’s wellbeing.

At this time she will request S/. 500 and is grateful for this opportunity and for the confidence shown in her. She promises to make her payments promptly. She will use the loan to purchase more sweets, such as candy, corn chips, cookies and gum, among other items

loans.use: to purchase sweets, such as cookies, candy and gum, among other items.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora está en su ciclo 5. Ellas son de la zona de Asunción, y cuentan que están aprendiendo a trabajar en conjunto, en sus barrios son muy conocidas por la unión que tienen y por su trabajo juntas.
Florentina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica hace un tiempo a las ventas, ya que tiene una defensa bien surtida en su casa. Ella es muy buena con sus clientes, además que siempre les ofrece buenos productos y buena atención, es por eso que está creciendo. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo está creciendo lentamente.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos a granel, verduras, carnes, lácteos y demás insumos para seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan y ella seguir generando los ingresos para su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas, ya que no solo se benefician ellas sino también sus familias.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora group is on its 5th loan cycle. They are from the Asunción area, and they say that they are learning to work together. In their neighborhoods, they are very well known for the bond they have and for their work together. 

Florentina is one of the members of this group. She has been selling for awhile, because she has a well-stocked pantry in her house. She is very good with her customers. She always offers them good prices and attention. This is why she is growing. She says that she started with a small business, but that thanks to her effort, she is slowly growing. She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, meats, dairy products, and more supplies in bulk, in order to continue giving her customers what they need and to keep earning an income for her family. She is grateful for the opportunity that they all have, since not only do they benefit, but so do their families.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, dairy products, and more in bulk.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Asunción, llamado San Cayetano trabajan juntas por su tercer ciclo, donde todas ellas están trabajando y quieren seguir aumentando los ciclos juntas para seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Lucia es parte de este grupo, ella es decoradora, se dedica a decorar todo tipo de eventos, es una mujer muy hábil y gracias a que tiene mucho talento en lo que hace ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Ella es una persona con ganas de salir adelante y crecer, quiere ir agrandando su negocio y el día de mañana ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group, San Cayetano, is from the city of Asunción, and they are working together on their third loan cycle. They are all working and they want to add more cycles together to continue helping their families. 

Lucia is part of this group. She is a decorator, who works decorating all kinds of events. She is a very capable woman, and because she is very talented at what she does, she already has a solid customer base. She is a person who wants to advance and grow. She wants to grow her business and soon be a great micro-businesswoman. She is asking for this loan to buy fabric and more supplies to be able to continue providing her customers with good service. She is thankful for this opportunity that she and her fellow group members have.

loans.use: to buy fabric to use in decoration.

loans.name: Hilario Trinidad

texts.es:
Hilario, de oficio comerciante, es originario de la comarca El Rodeo, municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, casado, tiene 2 hijos y un nieto que viven con él, todos están estudiando actualmente el mayor estudia en la universidad.
 Inicio sus actividades en el taller de elaboración y venta de rosquillas hace 10 años cuando regreso  de Costa Rica a la edad de 41 años aprendió de su esposa que anteriormente se dedicaba  a elaborar rosquilla sola cuando él estaba fuera del país pero cuando el regreso trajo un poco de dinero y puso el taller de rosquillas. Este es su primer negocio en el cual lo apoyan sus hijos y esposa. Su producto lo comercializa en las comarcas aledañas de manera ambulante. Tiene otros ingresos como la  compra y venta de queso también de manera ambulante. Le gustaría vender su producto a los supermercados porque lo vendería a un mejor precio. Las expectativas que tiene de su negocio son incrementar el volumen de producción de rosquillas. 
Otra expectativa de su negocio es incrementar los ingresos e invertir en la compra  de ollas grandes y mejorar del horno.
Solicito el préstamo  para la compra de  maíz, manteca, queso y margarina para la elaboración de rosquillas  materia prima que necesita  para incrementar el volumen de producción. Sus planes futuros son mejorar su vivienda y que su hijo culmine su carrera y construir otro horno para hornear rosquillas.
texts.en:
Hilario, a merchant, is originally from the region the Rodeo, municipality of Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. He is married with 2 children and a grandchild that are living with him, all are currently studying. The eldest is studying at the university.

Started his activities in the workshop of elaboration and sale of donuts 10 years ago when he returned from Costa Rica when he was 41 year old. He learned from his wife that had previously been making a living from donuts when he was outside the country. Then, when the return brought a bit of money and put the donut's workshop.

This is his first business in which he is helped by his wife and children. His product is marketed in the nearby areas in an itinerant manner. He has other income such as the purchase and sale of cheese also done in an itenerant manner. He would you like to sell his product to the supermarkets because he could sell at a better price. The expectation is to increase the production of donuts. Another goal for his business is to increase the revenues and invest in the purchase of large pots and improve the oven. 

He requested the loan to purchase corn, butter, cheese and margarine, the raw material, for the elaboration of donuts. His future plans are to improve his home, that his son finishes his career and to build another oven for baking donuts.

loans.use: to purchase corn, butter, cheese and margarine, the raw material, for the elaboration of donuts

loans.name: Booster Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Georgina from Masvingo. She is widowed with five children, three attending school.  Georgina runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenges faced are of low liquidity in the market; hence the business is low. Georgina has requested a loan of $1000 to buy groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income; hence improving her family welfare. In the future Georgina plans to buy a commercial stand.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Silvestra is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she can improve her store and serve more buyers and customers. 

In the future, Silvestra hopes to make her business profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, bread, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lidia habita en la ciudad de León, de 56 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender mercadería variada. Inicio en el comercio desde muy joven ayudándole a su mama, vendiendo mercadería variada como bisutería y cosméticos, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, luego  con el tiempo decidió independizarse y generar ingresos por sí sola, al igual que sus hijas quien le ayudan a vender su mercadería, salen  todos los día a vender siempre en busca de clientes y vendiendo para poder conseguir ingresos a diario. Ella dice  que cuenta con otros ingresos como es el salario que gana como profesora de un colegio enseña lengua y literatura. Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
Ella necesita el financiamiento para comprar perfumes, joyas de plata como pulseras, cadenas, brazaletes, anillos, chapas, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la mercadería que necesita tener en su negocio. Dentro de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, Pues su meta es ofrecer variedad de productos de uso personal y lograr poner una  tienda más grande solo de mercadería variada. Tratando de conseguir una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in the city of Leon. She is 56 years old, the mother of three children, and a shop-keeper by trade. She makes a living by selling merchandise. She started in the business when she was very young to help her mother sell different merchandise such as imitation jewelry and cosmetics. It was from this that she acquired experience and a complete knowledge of the business. Later she decided to go independent and generate revenue by herself. Similarly her daughters, who help her to sell her merchandise, go out every day to sell in search of customers and selling in order to obtain daily revenue. She says she relies on other income such as the salary she earns as a language and literature teacher in a high school. Her hopes are to continue expanding her business in order to obtain better profits.

She needs financing in order to buy perfumes and silver jewelry such as bracelets, chains, armbands, rings, badges, etc. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all the merchandise that she needs for her business. In her plans for the future is to be able to improve the infrastructure of her house. Her goal is to offer a variety of products for personal use and open a larger store of only varied merchandise. She is trying to obtain a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Doña Flor, una humilde señora de 50 años, es cliente Kiva, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida y pulpería,  se siente muy agradecida porque su primer crédito le fue de gran ayuda porque le vino en el momento que mas lo necesitaba porque pudo invertir mas en su negocio comprando productos mas demandado por sus clientes como sopas, jugos, detergente, arroz, azúcar, aceite, maíz y verduras. La cual se siente muy satisfecha  porque ha podido incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.  Es por eso que hoy en día necesita de su segundo préstamo para seguir ampliando su negocio comprando productos que aun no tiene en existencias como  sardinas, cervezas, galletas,  gaseosa y  productos enlatados como atún.  
Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo en su pulpería y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Flor, a humble 50-year-old woman, is a Kiva borrower who is a businesswoman. She works selling food and groceries. She is very grateful because her first loan was very helpful. It came to her in the moment she needed it most because she was able to invest more in her business, buying products that her customers want the most, like soup, juice, detergent, rice, sugar, oil, corn, and vegetables. She is very happy because she has been able to increase her sales and get better profits. She is why she needs a second loan: to continue expanding her business, buying products that she doesn't already carry, like sardines, beer, crackers, soda, and canned goods like tuna. One of her goals is to keep expanding her grocery store and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sardines, beer, crackers, soda, and canned goods like tuna.

loans.name: Maria  Esmelda

texts.es:
Maria, 43 años  de edad, originaria del Rama, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 3 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 12 años, debido a sus  condiciones de pobreza solo logro finalizar su primaria. Inicio su actividad  laboral a la edad de 35 años, sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque comenzó con poca mercadería como 10 litros de leche, 25 libras de arroz, 25 libras de frijoles, 25 libras de azúcar, fue asi que ella empezó su pequeño negocio, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante con su pulpería,  ella se siente muy orgullosa porque  ha  logrado incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, sus productos los comercializa en el lugar donde habita.
Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.  Maria esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, leche, galletas, jugo, productos de limpiezas, jabón, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar todos los productos que aun no tiene en inventario,  con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, dentro de sus planes futuros es seguir luchando para que su negocio se pueda mantener estable, sus metas próximas es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en: Maria, 43, is originally from Rama, but she currently lives in Managua. She is married and has three children, and she is a businesswoman. She owns a small grocery store, which she has owned for more than 12 years. Due to poverty, she was only able to finish primary school. She started this activity when she was 35. Her beginnings were difficult because she started without much merchandise, like 10 liters of milk, 25 pounds of rice, 25 pounds of beans, and 25 pounds of sugar. This is how she started her small business. With a lot of effort and hard work, she was able to move forward with her grocery store. She is very proud because she has been able to increase her sales and earn better profits. She has her husband's support. She sells her products in the place what she lives. Her hope is to expand her business. She is applying for financing to buy soda, rice, sugar, beans, milk, crackers, juice, cleaning products, soap, etc. She says that this loan will help her buy products that she doesn't already have in her inventory. Her goal is to meet her customers' needs. Her future plans are to keep fighting so that her business can stay stable. Her next goal is to turn her grocery store into a general store.

loans.use: to buy soda, rice, sugar, beans, milk, crackers, juice, cleaning products, soap, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
The hardworking Jackson has continued well with his mixed farming business with the help of his industrious wife. He has since diversified to potato farming besides the wheat which takes a shorter time to mature. He has also purchased more animals for fattening and resale.

He has requested another loan of KES 30,000 which will assist him in the purchase of animal feeds as well as farm inputs. He will use the additional proceeds to continue educating his children.

Jackson's dream is to grow his business into a highly profitable venture which will in turn improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and prepare his garden for growing crops.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Zainab from Moriba town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 23 years. Her children are currently attending school. Zainab runs a general stock business; she sells plastic bowls, buckets, knives and dishes. She has been running this business for the past year. She works at the business for ten hours per day, seven days each week. Her business is her only source of income. She describes her main problem as the cost of storage in the market. 

Zainaba has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock. The extra income from this loan will allow her to give her children a quality education. In the future, she plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as plastic bowls, buckets, knives and dishes.

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Douglas is a member of Khakakho Group in Chwele District. He is pictured with 24 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 12 men. Douglas is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Douglas first enrolled with the One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Douglas joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Douglas described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Douglas’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has operated her retail store for 33 years. She is now 57 years of age, married to a business man and has two children. At her age, she aspires to make her business stable and profitable in order for her to get ahead in life.

Delia would like to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 which would allow her to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, assorted biscuits, canned goods and sugar for her retail store. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan amount so she can build her business and improve her financial stability. In this way, she could save for emergency purposes when she and her spouse get weak.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, assorted biscuits, canned goods and sugar for her retail store

loans.name: Vernilyn

texts.en: Vernilyn earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked meals to the people in her local area. Vernilyn is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, seasonings and rice. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more foods thus improving her sales and profit. In the future, Vernilyn hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, seasonings and rice

loans.name: Kuma

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Kuma from Moriba town Southern area in Bo. She is married with two children between the ages of 15 years and 23 years. Her children are currently going to school. She also has two additional dependants at home. 

Kuma runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil and ginger. She works at the business every day, 10 hours per day. The transporting of goods is a very big problem because of the poor road network.

Kuma has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil and beans for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and beans for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Wilfredo has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 30 years now. 

Wilfredo is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and fuel for the boat. With those tools, he will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is a 38-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of six and twenty years. She runs a food stand business in Moriba Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school. She started this business because she needed a source of income to support the home.

For the past years she has been running her business within a busy market area. She sells dry fish, pepper, Maggi flavoring, and onions. At present her business is doing well. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy variety of cooking items like dry fish, pepper, Maggi, and onions. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to operate an international business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy variety of cooking items like dry fish, pepper, Maggi flavoring, and onions.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and makes it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Citra Jaya Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Hadi is from Kebon Pala, Jakarta, Indonesia. She is married to Ridwan who works as an air conditioning maintenance man. She has two children, Kusuma, 16 years old, and Dewanto, 10 years old. 

Hadi has two businesses in her house. In the morning she sells nasi uduk, a traditional breakfast in Java, in front of her house from 5:30 to 6:30 a.m. After that, she sells children snacks in front of her house. Hadi and her family still live with her parents.

Hadi has plans to add drinks to her business, so Hadi will use this loan to buy avocados, oranges to make juice and some kind of instant powder drink. Hadi will use this loan to buy instant noodles also.

From this business, she can provide her children's transportation fees to school. She can get 150,000 per day from both of her businesses. She has a dream of seeing her child work in a government company.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges and avocados, and instant noodles.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after two grandchildren. She has been selling small yellow bananas in the market at retail for 15 years, working six days a week. She also sells piped water and does farming to earn more income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to purchase more sweet yellow bananas to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business to a supplier and sell at wholesale as well.  She joined MCDT because she needed more capital. She rents a house without access to electricity but with piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet yellow bananas

loans.name: Marekhi

texts.en:
Marekhi is 27 years old. She lives in Etseri village, Terjola district with her husband Gaga, and is mother to an infant, Tamar. Marekhi requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The main income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a milk cow, a plot of agricultural land and a vineyard. The cow is milked to make dairy products. On the land they grow wheat, and the harvested product are sold locally at the markets along with the dairy products. In addition, Gaga is working on construction projects for private orders as an artisan and gets small monthly income.  

Marekhi requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Marekhi will start trading in fruits and vegetables. She will purchase from the market in Terjola at the wholesale price, bring it to her village and sell it with a retail price mark-up. Marekhi is experienced in agriculture and she hopes her business will be profitable. She will use the profit to reinvest in the same business. This will grow monthly income and enable Marekhi to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables at the wholesale price and resell it with a retail price markup

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a very hardworking person, who explains that thanks to her effort she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it. 

Today, she comes again for a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy three bags of coconuts for sale. With this she will be able to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy three bags of coconuts for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Lamarana

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Lamarana from Sierra Leone.  She is divorced with five children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. Lamarana has a table business selling miscellaneous foodstuffs such as gari, rice and eggplant in Kandeh Town in Bo. She initially started her business so that she can be financially independent and divorce her husband.  Previously, she was a housewife.  She would like the loan to purchase more gari, rice, eggplant and palm oil. In the next five years, she would like to own a big shop. She faces challenges with transporting her goods. The extra income will help her take care of her children. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gari, rice, eggplant and palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children and three of them attend school. She also looks after her sister. She has been selling small yellow bananas in the market for fifteen years, working six days a week. She also sells water as another source of income. 
She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business and to supply green bananas to wholesalers. She joined MCDT in order to increase her access to capital. She lives in her own house without access to electricity but with piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas to sell

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita is 50 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with her husband, son, daughter in-law and two infant children. Lorita requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Lorita’s husband. He is working as a driver on a bus line.

Lorita requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lorita wants to start trading in clothes. She will rent a counter at a big market in Tbilisi, purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell with the price markup. Lorita will be selling clothes herself. This will decrease her expenses and increase the profit. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in the same business and purchasing more clothes. Another part she will use for the family to provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To rent a counter and purchase clothes at wholesale prices to resell with the price markup.

loans.name: Dasy Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Daisy from Mutare. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school.  Daisy runs a retail business selling radios, TVs, solar panels and batteries locally in Mutare. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capital to meet demand. Daisy has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more stock for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Daisy plans to employ other people and create employment.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets for resale

loans.name: Leopard Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Tendai from Masvingo. She is a widow with two children, both attending school. She also cares for two dependents. Tendai runs a retail business selling clothes, shoes and DVDs. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge faced is debtors failing to pay on time. Tendai has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes, shoes and DVDs. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income, hence improving the family welfare. In the future Tendai plans to open another flea market table to increase outlets to sell from.

loans.use: to buy clothes, DVDs and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy material for her sewing business.

loans.name: New Life Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Janet from Mutare. She is married with four children; three are attending school. Janet runs a retail business selling groceries and clothing. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of enough stock in the shop with high demand. Janet has requested a loan of $400 to purchase groceries and clothing for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Janet plans to operate a general dealer shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries and clothing to supply to people in her local area.

loans.name: New Look Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Peter from Masvingo. He is married with two children, one attending school.  Peter runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge faced is the transportation of stock, which will affect the pricing of goods. Peter has requested a loan of $400 to buy groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his income, hence improving the family's welfare. In the future, Peter plans to increase the level of operation to be able to supply the community with all their grocery needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a teacher with 20 years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in the small village of Burastan, which is in Ararat region. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four: her 18-year-old daughter, 12-year-old daughter, husband and father-in-law. In the city, there is a high unemployment rate, but a farm business helps the family have some stable income. Susanna's elder daughter Lilit studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University with Khachatur Abovyan in the faculty of mathematics, physics and informatics. Susanna works hard to sustain the family and cover Lilit's education costs, but it is very difficult for her. Susanna has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. 

The loan is very important for Lilit. She dreams of getting a higher education and becoming a teacher like her mother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva, 24 years old, is from the small village of Terjola district. He is married and lives with his wife, an infant daughter and his parents. Shalva requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard with 400 samples of wine trees and a 1.2 hectare plot of land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. Shalva cultivates the land and does his best to insure a good harvest. In addition, they have a milking cow and two pigs. Shalva’s wife milks the cow and produces dairy products to sell. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Shalva requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Shalva will purchase a car. After the car is purchased, Shalva plans to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn money. This will increase the income of the family and his income will became stable. With the increased income, Shalva will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to serve local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has two school-going children who she is educating thanks to her job. She has been running her small store for a number of years. She has established customers and she is really well known thanks to the coconut products she offers to her customers. She wants to keep on investing in her activity and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy sacks of coconuts in order to continue offering her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is 54 years old. He lives in Balichi village, Bolnisi district with his wife Leila. Valerian requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
His family has 20 pigs and they sell piglets. In addition, they own a plot of land. Valerian cultivates the land and plants maize. Harvested maize and piglets are sold locally at the markets and the family gets a small monthly income.

Valerian requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Valerian will purchase a car. He wants to start selling pig feed. He will purchase it at the wholesale price and resell it with a price mark up. Breading pigs is very developed in his district so Valerian hopes the feed for pigs will be highly requested by his villagers. This will increase his income and Valerian will be able to provide better living conditions for him and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start selling pig feed

loans.name: Tity

texts.en:
Please meet 43-year-old Tity from Kandeh Town, Bo.  Bo is located in the southern region of Sierra Leone.  She is married with seven children, with the youngest one being 10 years old.  Currently, four of her children go to school. Her husband is a traditional healer.
  
Tity has a business selling general stock items such as sweets, biscuits, milk, sugar and juice.  She started her business in order to help her husband take care of the family.  She was a housewife before. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more general stock items such as sweets, biscuits, milk, sugar and juice to help her business grow.  One of the main challenges she faces is the great competition in the area where she sells her stock.  The extra income from the loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, milk, sugar and juice to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all of them attend school. She is also looking after her sister.
She has been selling raw food in the market for two years, working six days a week. She also sells cow peas to earn additional income.
She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase more foodstuff like bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to own a big shop for all kinds of clothes for wholesale.  She joined MCDT because of their interest in people with small businesses like herself. She rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and one of them attends school. She is not looking after any other family member.
She has been selling second hand clothes in the market for three years, working six days a week. She has no other source of income.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more second hand clothes. Her challenges include seasonality, thieves and transportation. Her dream is to own a second stall and buy land out of her profits. She joined MCDT because of the close services and convenience in accessing membership. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Suzzy Group

texts.en:
Suzzy group consists of six partners, all from Dansoman, Ghana. They are Susuana, Mary, Sabina, John, Dorothy and Alice. They sell foodstuffs, second-hand clothes, porridge ‘koko’, phone credits, food stuffs and seamstress services respectively. They have been together since 2012. 

Susuana is a 49-year-old foodstuff (plantain, cassava, vegetables, fish, coco-yam) seller. She is married to Emmanuel, a 55-year-old construction worker.  She needs a loan of GHS 1,500 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for the past 13 years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with the loans she took from ID Ghana and is now applying for her fourth loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling GHS 6,700 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more plantain, cassava, vegetables, fish and coco-yam to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Ana, 57 años de edad, habitante de la Ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 13 y 18 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de gaseosa y frescos, de la que es propietaria hace más de 1 año. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven, trabajando en la costura ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y salir adelante con sus hijos, pero con el tiempo ella decidió dejar el trabajo de costura, porque este negocio no le generaba muchas ganancias, es por eso que hoy en día se dedica a vender solo gaseosa y frescos naturales, negocio que le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas y su esposo, sus productos lo comercializa en su casa de habitación ya que es una zona muy transitada por las personas.
Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio. Ana está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar gaseosa,  bolsas, piña, naranja, melón, pajillas, etc. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de sus deliciosos frescos de frutas naturales, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos, dentro de sus planes futuro es poder ampliar su negocio con más productos para vender.
texts.en:
Ana is 57 years old, an inhabitant of the city of Granada, married, and the mother of two children of 13 and 18 years of age. She is a shop-keeper by trade and she makes a living by selling sodas and juices. She has been the owner of this business for more than a year.

She started in the world of business at a very young age, working in sewing since she needed a means of subsistence for her and her children, but with time she decided to leave sewing because it did not generate a lot of profit. For this reason she now sells only sodas and natural juices, which gives her daily profits. She relies on the help of her daughters and her husband. She sells her products from home since it is an area many people pass through. 

Her hope is to continue growing her business. Ana needs the financing in order to buy soda, bags, pineapple, orange, melon, straws, etc. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all the raw material she needs to make her delicious natural fruit juices, with the objective of increasing her sales and obtaining better revenue. In her future plans is to be able to expand her business with more products for sale.

loans.use: to purchase soda, bags, pineapple, orange, melon, straws, etc.

loans.name: Roset's Group

texts.en:
Roset's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Roset is 23 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Roset has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells tablets. 

To help expand her business, Roset has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock more drugs to sell, and will help Roset to generate greater profits and pay rent for the clinic. Roset hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Roset is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Moja One Group

texts.en:
Moja One is a group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District represented by Ezekiel. The group has 8 women and 3 men. Ezekiel is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of Sweet Potato, millet and sorghum. Ezekiel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Ezekiel joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Ezekiel described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Ezekiel’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 57, is a merchant. She makes a living by selling mainly dumplings. She has done this work for more than two years and she has a place in a popular market where she sells fresh dumplings to her customers every day.

She's a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning because she begins her work day very early. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy flour, sugar and trays for carrying dumplings to the market so that she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and trays for carrying dumplings to the market

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 42 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest is 5. Her husband is her business partner. She has been in business for one year. She wants a loan to buy more salt, soap and rice to sell in her store. The profit will be used to feed the household.

loans.use: To buy more salt, soaps and rice for sale.

loans.name: Jasmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jasmina, 46 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 24 años de edad, respectivamente, actualmente solo uno estudia y el otro trabaja, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tropigas y gaseosa. Inicio su actividad laboral a la edad de 35 años, trabajando para una empresa, luego al cerrar la empresa en donde laboraba, decidió emprender su propio negocio con la liquidación de su trabajo, empezó vendiendo tropigas(gas para cocinas), la cual miro que este negocio le generaba ganancias a diario,  fue así que comenzó agregando más productos como gaseosa, con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Jasmina está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar gas, gaseosa grande y pequeña y  jugos. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar todos los productos que aún no tiene en inventario con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos, uno de sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio para ir creciendo poco a poco como una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Jasmina is 46 years old and originally comes from Granada.  She is married and mother of two, aged 18 and 24 years old.  Currently one is studying and the other is working.  Jasmina is a businesswomen and she sells gas and fizzy drinks.  She started this work when she was 35 years old, when she was working for another company.  When the company closed down, she decided to start her own business with the redundancy payout.  She began selling gas (for kitchens) which she saw gave her a daily income.  She then started selling other products, such as fizzy drinks, with the aim of earning more money.  Jasmina receives support from her husband.

Jamina needs this loan loan to buy gas an large and small bottles of fizzy drinks and juices.  She thinks this loan will help her to buy all the products that she still doesn't have in stock and this will allow her to increase her income.  One of Jasmina's plans for the future is to expand her business so that, little by little, she can grow as a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy gas, large and small bottles of fizzy drinks and juices.

loans.name: Abelardo Antonio

texts.es: Don Abelardo un humilde comerciante, de 43 años de edad, es cliente Kiva, se dedica a vender billetes de lotería y  al mismo tiempo es dueño de una pulpería, el está muy agradecido por su primer préstamo porque le ha sido de gran ayuda ya que pudo invertirlo en su negocio comprando más billetes de lotería, de esta manera ha podido incrementar sus ganancias, es por eso que hoy día está solicitando su segundo préstamo para comprar gaseosa, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite,snacks, pan, huevo etc. con el propósito de agregar más productos a su pulpería para atraer más clientela, de esta manera ir  creciendo cada día más en su negocio. Dentro de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la calidad de vida familiar para vivir dignamente.
texts.en: Abelardo is a poor businessman.  He is 43 years old and, as a Kiva borrower, makes a living selling lottery tickets.  He also owns his own grocery store and is very grateful for his first loan.  It has been a great help to him as he was able to invest it in his business by buying more lottery tickets and this helped him to increase his income.  So now Abelardo is applying for a second loan to buy fizzy drinks, sugar, rice, beans, oil, snacks, bread, eggs and more so as to stock up his grocery store and attract more customers.  This way his business will grow a little bit every day.  One of Abelardo's future plans is to improve his family's quality of life so that they can live decently.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, sugar, rice, beans, oil, snacks, bread, eggs and more.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos, un humilde pescador, originario de Granada, él se siente muy satisfecho por su primer préstamo  le fue de gran ayuda porque le vino  en el momento que más lo necesitaba, ya que de esta manera pudo comprar todos los herramientas que se utiliza para la pesca como faroles, tambor de mecate, hilo y una malla de pescar, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Carlos está solicitando de su segundo crédito kiva para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de herramientas como trasmallo, faroles y para la compra de otra lancha. Unos de sus más grandes sueños es poder salir adelante con la ayuda de este préstamo.
texts.en: Carlos is a poor fisherman and originally from Granada.  He was very happy with his first loan.  It was a great help to him as he received it just when he needed it and he was able to buy all the tools he uses for fishing, like lanterns, rope, thread and a net so that he could increase his sales and improve his income.  Carlos is now applying for his second Kiva loan so that he can continue to invest in tools, such as a trammel-net and lanterns and to buy another boat.  One of his biggest dreams is to progress in life with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a trammel-net, lanterns and another boat.

loans.name: Rosidin

texts.en:
Rosidin runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also services bill payments for customers. He is an entrepreneur and has three persons living in his house. 

Rosidin joined Ruma eight months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Rosidin has had around $80-$90/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sayod

texts.ru: Сайёду 29 лет. Он холостой молодой человек. Сайёд живет с родителями в городе Куляб в юго-западной части Таджикистана.  Сайёд уже больше года как занимается животноводством.  В его деле помогает отец. Сайёд покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает в течение месяца и продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Сайёд энергичный и предприимчивый человек. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Sayod is 29 years old. He is a young bachelor. Sayod lives with his parents in the town of Kulob in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. Sayod has been doing animal husbandry for more than a year. His father helps him in this business. Sayod buys large horned cattle, feeds it for one month and then resells with a markup on the cattle market. He is an energetic and entrepreneurial man. He wants to increase the headcount of cattle and expand his business. Sayod is asking for a loan with a purpose to buy and resell large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy and resell large horned cattle.

loans.name: Barotali

texts.ru: Баротали 31 год. У него жена и трое детей. Баротали со своей семьей живет в городе Кулябе в юго-западной части Таджикистана. У Баротали высшее математическое образование и он работал по своей специальности три года.  Последние 4,5 года Баротали занимается торговлей.  На рынке города он имеет магазин, где продает продуткы питания, такие как чай, сахар, печенье, макароны, растительное масло и т.д.  С целью увеличения товарооборота и расширения своего бизнеса, Баротали запрашивает кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (продуктов питания) в свой магазин.
texts.en: Barotali is 31 years old. He has a wife and three children. Barotali lives with his family in the town of Kulob in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. Barotali has high education in mathematics and has worked in his profession for three years. The last four and a half years Barotali has been in sales. He has a store on the town's market where he sells food such as tea, sugar, cookies, pasta, vegetable oil and etc. With the goal to increase sales and to expand his business Barotali is asking for a loan to buy a variety of goods for his store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods (food) for his store.

loans.name: Safarhon

texts.ru: Сафар житель города Куляба, расположенного в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 37 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Сафар уже 6 лет как занимается торговым бизнесом.  На рынке своего города Сафар имеет торговую точку, где продает национальные мужские одежды. В его бизнесе помогает отец.  Сейчас Сафар хочет увеличить товарооборот и расширить свой бизнес. С этим намерением он запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента товара (национальной мужской одежды).
texts.en: Safar is a resident of the town of Kulob which is located in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. He is 37 years old. He has a big family. He is married and has five children. Safar has been in the sales business for six years. He has a vendor location on the town's market where he sells traditional men's clothing. His family helps him in this business. Right now Safar wants to increase sales volume and expand his business. With this purpose he is asking for a loan to buy a variety of goods (traditional men's clothing).

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise (traditional men's clothing).

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза молодая незамужняя девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она живет с родителями в районе Рудаки. Наргиза самостоятельная и независимая девушка. Она зарабатывает на жизнь, работая в артеле портнихой. Наргиза занимается вышиванием национальных женских одежд  уже 4 года и научилась этому делу у своей матери, которая тоже работает портнихой. Наргиза хочет расширить свою деятельность и запрашивает кредит для приобретения компьютерной  швейной машины для золотой вышивки платья.
texts.en: Nargiza is a young unmarried woman. She is 26 years old. She lives with her parents in the Rudaki region. Nargiza is an independent young woman. She makes a living by working as a seamstress in the shop. Nargiza embroiders traditional women's clothing for four years and has learned this from her mother who also works as a seamstress. Nargiza wants to expand her business and is asking for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine to make golden embroidery on dresses.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying clothes for resale to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying shoes for resale, to continue to earn a living

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying corn flour to resell, to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying food products (palm oil, onions, tomatoes,...) to resell, to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.ru: Назрулло 52 года. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Назрулло со своей семьей живет в районе Хамадони, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. У Назрулло высшее педагогическое образование. Он работал учителем более 10 лет. Последние 5 лет Назрулло занимается земледелием. Он имеет 5 га орошаемой земли, на которой выращивает пшеницу и овощи. Одновременно он занимается животноводством. В сезон посева Назрулло уже посеял пшеницу и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения, а также он еще хочет посеять овощи. С этим намерением он обратился за кредитом. Назрулло запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений, а также семян картофеля, лука и моркови.
texts.en: Narzullo is 52 years old. He is married and is a father of four children. Narzullo lives with his family in the region of Hamadoni which is located in the south part of Tajikistan. Narzullo has high pedagogical education. He has worked as a teacher for more than ten years. For the last five years he has been in agriculture. He has five hectares of arable land where he grows wheat and vegetables. At the same time he has been doing animal husbandry. During the sowing season Narzullo has sowed wheat and now to process the land he needs mineral fertilizer and also he wants to sow vegetables. With this purpose he has come for a loan. Narzullo is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds of potatoes, onion and carrots.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and also seeds of potatoes, onion and carrots.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida, de  52 años de edad, es dueña de una  humilde venta o  pulpería como popularmente se le conoce, habita en la ciudad de León , solo finalizo la primaria. Es madre de 9 hijos de los cuales solo dos están a cargo los demás viven independiente. Ella comenzó su negocio hace 4 años, pues anteriormente sobrevivían de la pensión de su esposo pero no era suficiente y necesitaba terminar de preparar con estudios a hijos menores por ese motivo puso  la pulpería pues las ganancias son diarias y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener su negocio. Ella utilizara el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar gaseosas, pan, queso, crema, caramelos, galletas y sopas.  Ella anhela convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea y que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Cándida is 52 years old and owns a small grocery store where she lives in the city of León. She only finished primary school. She has nine children, of which two still live at home with her – the rest are now independent.

Cándida started her business four years ago. Before starting her business, she survived on her husband’s pension, but it wasn’t enough and her young children still needed to finish their education. For this reason, she started the small grocery store, which gives her daily profits, and with a lot of effort she has been able to maintain her business. She will use this loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, carbonated soft drinks, bread, cheese, cream, candies, cookies, crackers and soup. She dreams of expanding her small grocery store into a larger general store so that her family would have what they need to live.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, carbonated soft drinks, bread, cheese, cream, candies, cookies, crackers and soup.

loans.name: Ana Amparo

texts.es:
Ana, de 43 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería desde hace 6 años tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad. Ella decidió poner una pulpería porque en su vecindario son escasos este tipo de negocios pero son de mucha necesidad, además que era una oportunidad de conseguir ingresos por sí misma y a la vez estar cerca de sus hijos ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa. 
Ana espera en lo futuro tener una distribuidora de alimentos donde sus clientes encuentren de todo para el hogar.  
Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para dama y caballero, ropa interior, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, leña.  Son parte de los productos más demandados y los que a diario solicitan sus clientes. Uno de sus planes es cancelar su crédito y sacar otro para invertir en la compra de más productos comestibles y mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and has two children, ages 18 and 16. She has had a small grocery store in her home for six years now. She decided to start her business because there weren’t many small grocery stores in her neighborhood but there was a great need for them. Moreover, it was an opportunity to earn income for herself while at the same time being close to her children.

Ana hopes in the future to expand her business into a larger store where her clients can find everything for the home.

She is requesting this loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing, underwear, basic grains, oil, sugar, bathroom tissue and firewood. These products are what her customers request the most on a daily basis. One of her plans is to pay off this loan so as take out another loan to buy more groceries to keep her store well stocked.

loans.use: to buy clothing, basic grains, oil, sugar, bathroom tissue and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy one bag of sweet potatoes and bread

loans.name: Kenia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Kenia una humilde joven de  23 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 3 años, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería de la que es propietaria hace más de 2 años, debido a sus condiciones de pobreza solo logro finalizar su tercer años de secundaria. Inicio desde muy joven en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo cajetas, ya que su mama es una persona muy trabajadora y le enseño a ganarse la vida de manera honrada y generar ingresos por sí misma, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante cada día, pero con las ganancias que le genera este negocio no se siente muy satisfecha, fue por eso que   decidió vender ropa para obtener ingresos extras, con el objetivo de ir invirtiendo mas en su pulpería, con productos que aún no tiene en inventario y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, actualmente solo se dedica a su pulpería.
Kenia está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijoles, gaseosa, aceite, etc. Ella dice que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar en mayor cantidad todos los productos para su pulpería, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Kenia is 23 years old, married, and has one child, who is three years old. She is a native of Granada and describes herself as being of humble means. 

Kenia has owned and worked in her own small grocery store for more than two years now. Because she was poor, she only finished her third year of secondary school. She started work in sales at a very young age, at first selling dulce de leche. She says her mother is very hardworking and showed her how to make an honest living for herself. Through her effort and hard work, she was getting ahead every day, but she was not satisfied with the earnings she was receiving from selling dulce de leche. For this reason, she decided to sell clothing to earn more income. She invested this income in her grocery store to add products to her inventory that she did not have but would satisfy the needs of her customers. Now she only works at her grocery store.

Kenia is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, beans, carbonated drinks, oil and other groceries. She says that this loan will help her to buy all of the products for her grocery store in larger quantities. One of her future plans is to make improvements to the building where she has her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, carbonated drinks, oil and other groceries.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, una humilde comerciante de 63 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella  estudio para ser maestra de primaria, pero también tiene su negocio de venta de sandalias al dejar de dar clases se dedicó por completo al comercio pero un día le llamo la atención un programa de televisión donde enseñaban manualidades en especial la elaboración de piñatas aprendió y decidió emprender este negocio variando formas, estilos, tamaños. Tiene 7 años con el negocio, sus productos los distribuye en los mercados,  por encargos, en su casa. El uso de colores diferentes, personajes de caricaturas, tamaños son atractivos que  buscan su principal clientela que son los niños. Por tal motivo necesita materia prima para trabajar, requiere comprar papel crepe, cartulinas, pegamentos, ollas de barro, alambre, fomi, máscaras, muñecas de plásticos, mecate, silicón, etc.   
Uno de sus proyectos es comprar una máquina de coser para elaborar manteles, cortinas, almohadas, cobertores para  vender y ofrecer variedad a su clientela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a humble 63 year old merchant. She lives in the city of León. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are grown. She studied to be a teacher but she also has has a business selling sandals. When she stopped teaching she became a merchant full time but one day a television program caught her attention where they taught crafts, especially making pinatas. She learned and decided to start this business with different shapes, styles and sizes. She has had this business for 7 years. She distributes her merchandise in markets, by order and from her house. The use of different colors, characters and sizes are things that her customers look for, who are mainly children. For that reason, she needs raw materials to work. She requires crepe paper, cardboard, glue, clay pots, wire, craft foam, masks, plastic dolls, cord, silicon, etc.  
 
One of her projects is to buy a sewing machine to make table cloths, curtains, pillows, and bedspreads to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy crepe paper, cardboard, glue, clay pots, wire, craft foam, masks, plastic dolls, cord, silicon, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia es habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de dos hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender muebles, lleva 6 años  con esta actividad. Inicio con muy poco capital poco a poco fue notando que era un negocio rentable pues los muebles que fabrican son artesanales, esta actividad la comparte junto con su esposo, en su pequeño taller elaboran camas, sillas , mesas, cunas de madera , llevan 6 años con esta actividad y de la cual sobrevive su familia y paga la escuela de sus hijos. Actualmente vende mesas de noche, roperos, sillas mecedoras. Poco a poco quiere aumentar la variedad de muebles para ofrecer a su clientela. Ella  esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar madera, pegamento, clavos, tornillos, pintura, barniz y lijas. Esto le ayudara a conseguir con mayor facilidad la materia prima que necesita para elaborar variedad de muebles para el hogar.  Ella sueña con tener una gran mueblería  y poder mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa para darle un techo digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and two children in the city of León. For the past six years she has worked selling furniture. She says she started out with very little capital but gradually saw that the business was profitable because the furniture they make is crafted by hand. Claudia shares this business with her husband. In their small workshop they make beds, chairs, tables and wooden cribs. Their business has allowed them to provide for their family and pay for their children’s school. She currently sells night tables, wardrobes and rocking chairs. She hopes to gradually increase the variety of furniture she can offer to her customers.  

Claudia is requesting this loan to buy wood, glue, nails, screws, paint, varnish and sandpaper. She says the loan will make it easier for her to obtain the raw materials she needs to make a variety of home furniture. Her dream is to have a large furniture store to improve her earnings and build a suitable house for her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, nails, screws, paint, varnish and sandpaper.

loans.name: Nelson Celestino

texts.es:
Nelson, 33 años de edad originario de Telica municipio de León, casado, padre de 2 hijos. Él es carpintero lleva 10 años dedicándose a fabricar muebles, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven con la idea de poner su propio taller y así lo hizo. Actualmente este es el único negocio con el cual sostiene a su familia, cuenta con la ayuda de tres trabajadores. El sale a vender de manera ambulante todo lo que elabora en su taller, también hace reparaciones de muebles. Su esposa se dedica a dar clases de primaria. El desea ampliar su taller de carpintería, fabricar variedad de muebles de calidad, poder dar empleo a más personas y lograr tener su propia tienda de muebles finos en el centro de la ciudad. 
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar madera y máquina para lijar y pulir madera.
texts.en:
Nelson is 33 years old. He is from Telica, municipality of León. He is married and the father of 2 children. He is a carpenter and for 10 years has made furniture. He learned this profession when he was very young with the plan of opening his own workshop, which he did. Right now, this is the only business with which he supports his family and he has the help of three workers. He goes out to sell everything he makes in his workshop as a street vendor. He also repairs furniture. His wife is a primary school teacher. He wants to expand his workshop, making quality furniture and serving as an example for more people, with his own fine furniture store in the center of town.
 
He needs the loan to buy wood and a machine to sand and polish wood.

loans.use: to buy wood and a machines to sand and polish wood.

loans.name: Erling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Erling, una humilde joven ,24 años de edad, es madre de 2 dos pequeñas niñas  de 5 y  2 años de edad. Ella  vive en uno de los barrios más pobres de Estelí, trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza.

 Ella empezó en este negocio a los 19 años de edad, trabajando con su cuñada pero después ella vio que era un buen negocio y le producía ganancias   entonces decidió hacerlo por  cuenta propia además que le permitió con sus ingresos contribuir al sustento de su familia, su esposo trabaja lavando carros en una gasolinera con lo que el  gana ella compra la comida y paga la escuela para su hija mayor.
 Ella solicita este crédito para poder comprar cremas, perfumes ropa y artículos de cocina y zapatos todos de la misma línea que ella vende ella se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le damos al darle financiamiento para este fin cree que le ayudara mucho porque tendrá más inventario para mostrar a sus clientes sus productos y aumentar sus ingresos.  Una de sus metas próximas es mejorar la infraestructura de su humilde casa ya que el techo y la madera  están deteriorándose y desea brindarles un techo digno a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Erling is a humble 24 year old woman. She is the mother of 2 little girls, aged 5 and 2. She lives in one of the poorest neighborhoods of Estelí and sells beauty products.  

She started this business when she was 19, working with her sister in law. Later she saw that it was a good business and produced earnings, so she decided to do it on her own. This allowed her to have income to contribute to the support of the family. Her husband works washing cars at a gas station and what he earns pays for the food and schooling for their oldest daughter. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy creams, perfumes, clothing, cooking items and shoes, all from the same line that she sells. She is happy for the opportunity that we are giving her for this. She thinks it will help her a lot because she will have more inventory to show her customers her products and increase her income. One of her main goals is to improve the infrastructure of her humble home, since the roof and the wood are deteriorating and she wants to give her daughters a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfume, clothing, cooking items and shoes.

loans.name: Tubeho Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe Tubeho et   habite à Ngozi. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Césarée, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils sont 6 enfants âgés  âgés de  1  à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Il prend soin de son neveu qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des pièces de rechange, de postes de radio et il vend aussi le service de charge batterie.

Il  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  un chargeur batterie et de pièces de rechange de poste de radio à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Tubeho group and lives in Ngozi. He is 41 years old and married to Césarée, a farmer. The couple have 6 children, aged between 1 and 12, three of whom attend school. He is also taking care of his nephew, who is a student.
