texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are attending school. She is looking after additional family members (brother and sister). She has been operating a retail shop for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She does not earn any income from other sources. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dreams are to own a fully stocked retail shop and to build her own house. She joined MCDT because it provides small loans, enabling the borrowers to grow their businesses gradually. She lives with her husband in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Jallety

texts.en:
Jallety is a 54-year-old lady who owns rental houses in Kilifi, Kenya. She is married and a mother of two children; her husband provides additional income. She has been in the rental business for the last twelve years and has done great. 

This marks her fifth loan from KADET LTD to renovate her rental houses. She hopes to live a happy life in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Dama's Group

texts.en: Dama, the leader of this group, is a thirty-three-year-old mother of five. She and her husband grow maize, cowpea, cassava, and coconuts. Her main challenge in her farming business is a lack of transport to get her crops to the market to sell. She is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program, because currently there are only small trees in her village, and she is excited that soon the KOMAZA trees will grow quite tall. She plans on using her income from the KOMAZA trees to send her younger children to secondary school and university, and to open a water kiosk.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Rubén Josue

texts.es: Rubén Josué es un joven de 32 años, padre de tres hijos, es propietario de un negocio de frutas y verduras ubicado en un lugar especifico de la ciudad de Chinandega, ciudad de donde es residente, inició esta actividad económica desde hace quince años, desde muy joven se vio obligado a trabajar ya que proviene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos. Ha logrado salir adelante gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor, porque aparte de su negocio de fruta y verduras también ha podido establecer  un negocio de triciclos comercial, con el cual presta el servicio de transporte por toda la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería en la compra de verduras y frutas como: sandías, papayas, cocos, pipían, ayote, chayote, plátanos, naranjas, guayaba, cálala, limones. Y de dicha forma aprovechar la temporada Semana santa  donde las ventas y utilidades aumentan.
texts.en:
Rubén Josué is a 32-year-old youth and father to three children. He is the owner of a fruit and vegetable business situated in a specific place in the city of Chinandega, the city where he lives. He began this economic activity when he was 15 years old. From very young he saw himself as obligated to work since he comes from a family of scarce economic resources. He has been able to go on thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit because, apart from his fruit and vegetable business, he also has been able to establish a commercial tricycle business with which he provides transportation services throughout the city.

He is applying for this loan to invest in the capital of his business and supply his merchandise with the purchase of vegetables and fruits like watermelons, papayas, coconuts, pipián squash, pumpkin, chayote, plantains, oranges, guava, passion fruit, and lemons. In this way he will take advantage of the Holy Week season when his sales and usefulness increase.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, papayas, and coconuts, among other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all of them are attending school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

Cissy has been operating a food stall for the last eight years, working seven days a week. This is her only source of income. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (USh) from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase more raw ingredients for foodstuffs, like banana fingers, clusters, onions, tomatoes, cabbages, and Irish potatoes. Her business challenges include seasonality and transport. 

Cissy's dream is to own a fully-stocked food stall and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT because of the small loans it gives, allowing members to gradually grow their businesses. She lives with her husband in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more food items, like banana fingers, clusters, onions, cabbages, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. Ей 36 лет. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Хамадони, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. Муж Марчоны занимается купле-продажей ткани в городе Душанбе.  Марчона тоже работает в сфере торговли. На рынке своего района она арендует торговую точку, где занимается продажей тканей. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже два года. Теперь она намерена увеличить товарооборот и расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи ткани.
texts.en: Marjona is married and has three children. She is 36 years old. She lives with her family in the Hamadoni Region in the south of Tajikistan. Marjona’s husband buys and resells fabric in the city of Dushanbe. Marjona also works in retails. She leases a sales stand at the market in her town and sells fabric. She has been in this business for two years. At present she plans to increase her sales volume and expand her business. With this goal, she is requesting a loan to stock up on fabric for resale.

loans.use: to stock up on fabric for resale.

loans.name: Shirikisho Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a member of the Shirikisho Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured with twelve One Acre Fund farmers, all women. Josephine is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Josephine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Josephine joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Josephine described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre's worth of agricultural inputs on credit. Josephine’s group will receive a total of six acres worth of inputs.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 57 years old and married to Abdalla. They have seven young children who are in school, so both strive to get ahead and provide for their children.

She operates a food stall from her house. Thanks to the good variety she offers, she has been able to establish a good clientele. She is a hard-working woman and says that she wants to continue growing in her current profession. For this reason, she strives to do her best. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products. This way she can continue offering her customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Salma has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair products. 

To help expand her business, Salma has requested a loan of 1300000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other kinds of hair products, and will help Salma generate greater profits and improve on the business. Salma  hopes that in the future she will be able to open another business . 

Salma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of hair products

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Zephaniah is a member of Jitegemee Group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is pictured with twelve One Acre Fund farmers: eight women and four men. Zephaniah is standing on the right with his hand raised. Zephaniah joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Zephaniah joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and grow enough food for his family.

Zephaniah described his harvest as very good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Zephaniah’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en: Candida is 32 years old, married and has five children, ages 2 to 11. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in the food business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. With the profit, she will finish up her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 41 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is a high school graduate and is good at managing her business. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 23. They all are in school and live at home. For the past three years, she has been selling  palm oil, rice, pepper, etc in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business,

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es: Juan de 46 años, casado, padre de 4 hijos en edades escolares, que con mucho sacrificio la mayor de sus hijos asiste a la universidad a pesar de que la educación superior es costosa en el país,  originario de un municipio ubicado al norte de departamento de Chinandega, inicio hace 12 años un negocio de destace de cerdos y con el tiempo cambio a destace de res ya que le daba mejores ganancias la res, negocio que consiste en comprar vacas y destazarlas para la venta de carne,  su meta es en un futuro comprar un tramo en el mercado de su municipio para vender su carne en un lugar fijo y no venderla de manera ambulante. Juan solicita este crédito para comprar vacas ya que son costosas.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old, married, and the father of four school-aged children. With a lot of sacrifice, the oldest of his children attends the university despite the fact that higher education is expensive in his country. He is originally from a municipality situated in the northern part of the department of Chinandega. Twelve years ago, he began a business butchering pigs, and with time, he changed to butchering beef since beef gave him a better profit. His business consists of buying cows and butchering them to sell the meat.

His future goal is in to purchase a stall in the market of his municipality in order to sell his meat in a fixed place and not sell it on the street. Juan is requesting this loan to buy cows since they are expensive.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Magrate is a 41-year-old mother. She supports a family of six people. She is married and was blessed with five children, two of whom are over 18 years old, and the last three are 12, 6, and 4 years old.

Magrate operates a dairy farming business. She has been doing this for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more dairy cows for milk production. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Magrate has a dream of becoming the most successful farmer in her region, since where she comes from is a marginalized area.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to rear for milk production.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 36-year-old woman who lives in West Point, Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She lives with her two children, 5 and 9, who are in school. Martha is married and did not attend school herself. 

For the past three years, Martha has been selling biscuits, soap, toothpaste, rice, pepper, etc. from a table in the local market. Sometimes business is slow, but most of the time she realizes a profit, which she uses to sustain her family. Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more stock in order to expand her sales. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, soap, toothpaste, rice, pepper, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Mwaniki

texts.en:
Mwaniki, 31 years, is married and works as a merchant. She is the owner of a store where she's been working for two years. She says that she's making headway with the business, because she has attracted a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KShs) to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en:
Elnura is 36 years old and married. She is the mother of two sons, ages 14 and 16, who help Elnura manage the business. Her husband works in Russia selling fruits and vegetables. The money he sends to Elnura each month helps her to support her sons' education. To provide for their other needs, Elnura works with livestock breeding, sells milk products and sometimes sells cattle for meat purposes. 
She is a very honest and purposeful person. All that she achieves is due to her diligence. 
With an aim to further develop her business, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN for the purchase of one head of cattle and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle and one calf.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Memunatu from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 28. She started her business because she wants to create a source of income.

Menunatu runs a business selling cool water, rice, pepper, fish and cooking seasonings. She works at the business nine hours per day and six days per week. She says sometimes business is very difficult.

Menunatu has requested a loan to buy a variety of food commodities like cool water, rice, pepper, fish and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food commodities like cool water, rice, pepper, fish and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Mamahawa

texts.en:
This is 36 year old Mamahawa from Kandeh Town in Bo, Sierra Leone.  She is married with nine children, ages 16 months to 18 years.  Five of her children are currently attending school.  
Mamahawa has a cookery business that also sells other foodstuffs such as palm oil.  She works seven days per week at her business. She entered into business because her mother was a businesswoman. She also wanted to help her husband educate her children. She intends to purchase more products to increase her cookery business.  In the future, she wants to expand her business to eventually move into a standalone shop.  She will use the loan proceeds to improve her family’s living condition and educate her children. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase her cookery business.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 40 year-old mother of five. She and her husband grow various crops on their farm. 

She faces the challenge of pests that cause her crops to die. 

Fatuma is excited to work with KOMAZA because of the beautiful scenery the trees provide as they grow tall. She hopes to use the income from her KOMAZA trees to purchase hives so she can keep bees on her land, and to buy improved breeds of cows and goats so she can have higher quality livestock.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 39 years old. She has six children in school. She has had a grocery store for three years, thanks to the help from her husband. Together, they help one another with the family's expenses.

Fatuma is asking for this loan to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store, so she can offer a greater variety to her customers and be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store.

loans.name: Saumu's Group

texts.en:
Saumu is a thirty-eight-year-old mother of five children and is a businesswoman. She bakes cakes to earn money for her family. However, her income is irregular due to low demand. 

When asked why she is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program, Saumu says, "Since my neighbors are doing this project, and what I can see inspired me to join. The trees will improve my life in that it will help me educate my children." 

In addition to sending her children to school, Saumu also hopes to use the profits from her tree farm to start a business that will earn her a daily income.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Elmon

texts.en:
Elmon is 46 years old and lives in West Point, which has one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is a widow and has three children aged between 20 and 25 years of age. Her children are in school and live at home.

For the past two years she has been selling flour, oil, sugar and rice. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. 

Elmon is requesting a loan to purchase flour, oil, sugar and rice for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, sugar and rice for her business

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Jestina from Torkpoi town, Bo. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 10 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Jestina established her table business within a busy market area. She began her business because she needs to create a permanent source of income to support herself. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. Sometimes the purchasing power is very slow and difficult.  

Jestina requires a loan in order to buy cooking oil, onions, pepper and Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews). She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her life and educate her children. 

In the future, Jestina plans to see her business bigger than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, onions, pepper and Maggi.

loans.name: Trifine

texts.en:
Trifine is 49 years old. She is married with six children. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. Her husband is a farmer. 

Trifine has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to buy more beans for sale. With the profit, she will feed her children and pay for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

Mastula has been selling banana leaves at wholesale in the market for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

Mastula has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more banana leaves for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to collect the banana leaves from the village and supply them in other markets. She joined MCDT because of the good customer care exhibited by the staff. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of banana leaves for sale.

loans.name: Zeitun's Group

texts.en: Zeitun is the leader of Zeitun's Group. She is a 26-year-old mother of two children. She and her husband are both dryland farmers, so their agricultural endeavors face the challenge of frequent droughts. Zeitun plans to use the income from her KOMAZA tree farm to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais um irmão que vive com ele.
Trabalha como empacotador de bananas numa empresa de produção de bananas e é dono de um negócio de venda de produtos diversos.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, arroz, peixe, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e garantir a formação dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento maior e para obter mais lucros.
texts.en:
Orlando is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house and also provides for his brother who lives with him.

He works as a banana packer for a banana producer and also owns a grocery business. With this loan he intends to buy products (peanuts, rice, fish, beverages and others) to increase his quantity of merchandise.

In the future, Orlando wishes to grow his business and guarantee an education for his children. He is committing to repay the loan so he can request further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to invest more in his business by building larger premises, in order to make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, rice, fish, beverages and others) to increase his quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Hawa from Sierra Leone. She lives in Moriba Town, Bo, located in the southern region of the country. She is widowed with 4 children, with the youngest being 4 years old. Two of her children currently attend school.

Hawa runs a business selling palm oil. She started the business to improve the life of her family. She works at her business for 9 hours per day, every day of the week. 

She wants to use this loan to purchase more palm oil. She says that transportation for her business is a challenge. She wants to use the extra income generated from the loan to improve the life and education of her children.

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, two of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling pineapples at retail from a market for ten years, working seven days a week, and has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to be able to purchase more pineapples to sell. 

Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy a piece of land and grow her own pineapples and become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because they take services to where members stay. She rents a house.

loans.use: to buy more pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of them attend school. She is also looking after her cousin and sister.

She has been running an eating place for the last two years, working six days a week. She also sells raw sweet potatoes and cassava to earn more income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 shillings from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy stock of green bananas, dry peas, beans, rice, beef, and flour for the eating place. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to sell all kinds of raw food alongside the eating place.  

She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She stays with her husband in a rented house without access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, dry peas, beans, beef, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Catherine from Torkpoi town Bo, a married mother of six children between the ages of 13 and 29. She has two additional dependents living with her.

Catherine runs a drug store selling blood syrup, malarial drugs and pain medication. She has been operating this business for the past five years, working eight hours per day, seven days per week. Catherine says that transportation costs are the main challenge to her business.

Catherine has requested a loan in order to buy more medical drugs for resale. The extra resulting income will allow her to improve her business. In the future, she plans to open a clinic. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 1 ainda frequenta a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos e 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É pensionista e negociante, dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, arroz, sabão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial e fazer crescer o negócio para obter mais rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é arranjar uma fonte de rendimento para acrescentar a sua receita e a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a single mother of five children, one of which still goes to school. She lives in her own home and also provides for two nephews and two grandchildren who live with her.

She is a pensioner and also owns a general store business. With this loan she intends to buy products (beer, soft drinks, rice, soap and others) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

In the future she wishes to expand her commercial premises and grow her business in order to make more income. She is committing to repay the loan so she can request further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenges are the lack of available funds to carry out all her projects and finding another source of income.

loans.use: to buy products (beer, soft drinks, rice, soap and others) for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and the mother of five children, three of whom attend school. She helps support her family by running a stall where she sells children's clothes. She has had this stall for eight years, and works there seven days a week. She earns additional income by roasting maize. She is requesting a loan for US $125 from MCDT-SACCO so that she can buy more clothing to sell. Her challenges include the seasonal nature of her business and transportation expenses. Her dream is to open a second outlet. She joined MCDT because of the small loans it gives, allowing members to gradually grow their businesses. She lives with her husband in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of children's clothes.

loans.name: Tennah

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Tenneh from Torkpoi town Bo. She is single mother with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 9 years. Two of her children are going to school. She started her business because she did not go to school, so her mother trained her for the business.

Tenneh runs a dry fish business, where she sells dry fish within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Tenneh has requested a loan in order to buy more dry fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve herself and educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business to a big fish table. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Isatu from Sierra Leone.  She is widowed with five children, aged 3 to 15.  Two of her children attend school, and she earns a living by selling food items in the town of Waterloo, which is located near the capital city of Freetown.  She has had this business for 20 years, and works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.  She will use this loan to buy more items to sell, such as sugar and onions.  She says that her greatest challenge is a lack of capital.  In the next five years, she hopes to move from a stall to a stand-alone shop. The loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including sugar and onions.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty lives in Waterloo, Sierra Leone. She is 21 years old and married. Her husband is a trader, and she earns a living by selling food items such as oil, pepper and onions in the local market. She went into business in 2007 because she had to stop going to school. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day of the week. She is requesting this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to expand her business by buying more sugar, oil, flour and pepper to sell to her customers. With the extra income from this loan, she wants to build a house in the next five years. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, oil, flour and pepper to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 23 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populous and well known areas in Montserrado county,  She is single and has three children between 8 to 12 years old. Her children live at home and go to school. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling fish in the local market. Her main challenge is the slowdown in business during the rainy season. She requesting a loan to buy fish for her business, and will use the extra income she earns to help build a house.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 27 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is single and has two children, aged 5 and 10 years old. For the past ten years she been operating a shop in her community. She likes the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, peppers, onions, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Duba

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Duba, from Moriba town in Bo. She is married with three children; the youngest is 13 years and the oldest is 20 years. Two are currently attending school. 

Duba established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed a permanent income to support the home. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 6 days per week. When there is a crisis of fuel, it leads to her goods being delayed.

Duba requires a loan in order to buy more local food, like palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her life and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Duba plans to open several stores in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food, like palm oil.

loans.name: Ishamie

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ishamie.  He is married but has no children. In 2004, Ishamie established his hair products business. He began his business as a means of getting income. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Ishamie would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy more hair extensions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Ishamie plans to expand his business to standard so that he can be fit for any competition. He is hard-working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for drinks, provisions, water and cosmetics

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Yayah.  He is married and has five children aged 19, 16, 14, 12 and 8. In 2002, Yayah established his used bed sheet business. He began his business just to enable him to take good care of his family. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are men and women. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Yayah has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used things for 3,000,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to buy quality products that will increase his sales.

 In the future, Yayah plans to complete the construction of his unfinished house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Eric.  He is single and has no children.   In 2008, Eric established his drinks business. He began his business just to generate funds to further his education. His business is located at the city centre and his main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. 

Eric would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks for Le 500,000, Star beer for Le 500,000 and stout for Le 500,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level. In the future, Eric plans to further his education, and to travel abroad. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres indígenas  donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y por ese motivo se esfuerzan el doble por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ambrocia , quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno.  Tiene como negocio una pequeña despensa en la que ella trabaja arduamente y desea poder seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, leche, panificados, carnes y demás, ya que con esto podrá seguir con sus ventas y dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Aty is in its first loan cycle with the women's program. The members are indigenous women who work and help each other get ahead. All the members live below the poverty line, according to the poverty reduction survey they took, and, therefore, are striving extra hard to make progress. 

The survey showed that Ambrocia, one of the members, lived at poverty level one. She has a small store where she works very hard, and she wants to keep doing so. So she has applied for a loan to buy beverages, milk, baked goods, meats, and more so that she can keep selling the items her customers need.

loans.use: to buy beverages, milk, baked goods, meats, and more.

loans.name: Mbaapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mbaapora está en su segundo ciclo, son mujeres humildes que luchan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Maria es una de ellas, y cuenta que con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar para su peluquería.
Día a día trabaja desde muy tempranas horas y cuenta que tiene buena cantidad de clientes que siempre se acercan a ella, ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos. Es muy trabajadora la Sra. Maria y lo muestra con todo lo que tiene.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, ya que son los insumos que mas usa en su negocio y los que siempre necesita.
texts.en:
Group Mbaapora is in its second cycle. They are all humble women that struggle and work hard to get ahead. María is one of them, and says that with a great effort, she has managed to open a beauty salon.

María works every day, starting early in the morning. She says that she has a good base of clients that come to her because she is good at what she does. María is a tenacious woman, who works as hard as she can.

María is requesting a loan to invest in buying dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams and other products that she frequently uses.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, conditioners, creams and other supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinstall wiring in his house.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru: Махмадулло житель района Хамадони, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. Ему 38 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Махмадулло занимается торговлей более 5 лет. Он имеет собственный магазин, где продает продукты питания, такие как: макароны, чай, печенье, яйцо, растительное масло, консервированные продукты, фруктовые соки, напитки и т.д. Махмадулло энергичный и предприимчивый человек. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и расширить свой торговый бизнес. Махмадулло берет кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (продуктов питания) в свой магазин.
texts.en: Mahmadullo lives in the Hamadoni region in the southern part of Tajikistan. He is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. For the past 5 years, he has been working in retail. He has his own shop where he sells groceries, including macaroni, tea, cookies, eggs, vegetable oil, canned goods, fruit juice, various beverages, and so on. He is an energetic and enterprising man. Mahmadullo is seeking a loan to increase his turnover and expand his retail business. He will use the loan money to purchase an assortment of groceries for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
8 de diciembre es un grupo que está empezando a trabajar juntas, están aprendiendo, y esperan que por medio de las capacitaciones puedan crecer. Todas ellas son mujeres indígenas que están muy agradecidas por esta gran oportunidad que reciben.
En su mayoría ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, vacas, patos, cerdos y demás. Una de ellas es la Sra. Lucila, quien es una gran luchadora, tiene muchos animales que cría, faena o vende, y así ayuda a su familia teniendo los medios que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para que no le falte comida para sus crías.
texts.en:
The 8th of December communal bank was begun by members who are working together, learning, and hoping to grow through training. The members are indigenous women who are very grateful for the opportunity they have received. 

Most of the women raise livestock such as chickens, cows, turkeys, and pigs. Lucila, one of the members, is a great worker. She raises animals and catches fish, which she sells to provide her family with what it needs. She has applied for a loan to buy nutritious animal feed, which would be a great help because she doesn't want to be without feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed.

loans.name: Teco Joaju Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi está integrado con 5 jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Uno de estos jóvenes es  Liliana, quien tiene 15 años , cuenta que está queriendo Poner cantina en su casa ya que no hay algo similar en su Barrio y en los alrededores de su casa hay una cancha de vóley donde hay mucho potencial para vender  y asi poder tener más ingreso para la casa. Ella es una joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles.
Liliana pide este crédito para poder comprar comestibles y bebidas para vender.
En la foto del grupo se encuentran los jóvenes emprendedores y sus padres.
texts.en:
This group comes from the city of Villa Ygatimí and is composed of five young persons who got together in order to start working, progress and help their families. They feel enthusiastic now that they will be able to help with the home expenses, which makes them feel useful.

One of these young persons is Liliana, who is 15 years old and says that she wants to open a canteen at home, knowing that the neighborhood lacks such a business. Besides, there is a volleyball court close to her house, which means sales potential and an income for her family. Liliana is a young woman that comes from an honorable and hardworking family, and that wants to follow her parents’ example and help them.

Liliana is requesting a loan to buy food and beverages to sell. In the picture, the young entrepreneurs are accompanied by their parents.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como agricultora e tem a própria machamba.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, tijolos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua residência. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e conseguir manter se saudável para garantir a execução de seus projectos.
texts.en:
Madalena is single and the mother of 5 children, who all attend School, lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as a farmer and has her own plantation. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others) to  continue the building work on her home.

In future Madalena wishes to complete her house to provide her family with a better level of comfort. To this end, she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work more and manage to stay healthy so as to guarantee that she is able to carry out her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others) to  continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Dilshodjon

texts.ru: Дилшоджон житель района Дж.Руми, располагающийся в южной части Таджикистана. Ему 23 года. У него есть жена и один маленький ребенок. Отец Дилшоджон пенсионер. Сам Дилшоджон занимается купле-продажей скота. Жена Дилшоджон умеет вышивать национальные женские одежды. Однако у нее нет швейной машины. Дилшоджон намерен помочь своей жене в открытии своего дела. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения швейной машины для новой деятельности жены.
texts.en: Dilshodjon lives in the J. Rumy region in the southern part of Tajikistan. He is 23 years old, married, and has one small child. His father is retired, and Dilshodjon earns a living by buying and selling cattle. His wife is skilled at embroidering traditional national dresses, but she does not have a sewing machine. He wants to help his wife open her own business, and for this reason, Dilshodjon is seeking a loan to purchase a sewing machine so she can get started.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for his wife's new business

loans.name: José Osmar

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo. Hace mas de 10 años, aprendió la profesión de soldador, lo aprendió iniciando como ayudante en un taller de estructuras metálicas y así que poco a poco fue perfeccionando la técnica. Antes de trabajar como soldador, era pescador artesanal en la zona de la costa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más herramientas para elaborar los pedidos de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda. Entre mas herramientas posea podrá tener variedad de estructuras para vender más e incrementar sus ingresos. Su dese es instalar el negocio en casa de sus suegros, ya que quiere estar cerca de su familia y más aún porque su esposa esta a punto de dar a luz a su segundo hijo. Lo que más desea es tener ingresos suficientes para los gastos de maternidad de su esposa y construir su propia casa para vivir dignamente junto con su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José, 37, is married and has a son. Ten years ago, he learned to be a solderer as an assistant in a metal shop and has slowly perfected the skill.  Before becoming a solderer, he was a traditional fisherman in the coastal area.

He will use the loan he has requested from  Fundación Campo to buy more tools to fill customer orders and meet demand. He needs more tools to make a variety of items to sell and increase his earnings. He would like to set up his business in his in-laws' house because he wants to be close to his family and because his wife is about to give birth to their second child. Most of all, he wants to have enough income to pay for the delivery costs and to buy his own home where he can live in dignity with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy more tools to fill customer orders and meet demand.

loans.name: Anabela

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 4 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É negociante e dono do próprio negócio de venda de roupas e bolsas femininas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar roupas e bolsas na AFRICA DO SUL para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja remodelar a sua casa e construir um murro, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Anabela is a widow and a mother of 5 children, 4 of whom attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She is a trader and owns her own business selling clothes and women's purses. With this loan she plans to buy clothes and purses in South Africa to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future, Anabela hopes to remodel her home and build a wall around it. To this end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the high cost of living and the lack of funds to carry out all of her projects.

loans.use: buy clothes and purses in South Africa to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operário agrícola numa empresa de fabrico de bananas e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra de mais 1 quarto e uma sala na sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e as remodelações da sua casa e abrir um negocio para aumentar a sua renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento devido do empréstimo e manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Julio is married and the father of 4 children, 2 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a farmer for a company that produces bananas and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, metal sheets, beams and others) to continue to build an extra room and living room in his house.

In future, Julio hopes to complete the remodelling on his home and start a business to increase his income. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to pay off the loan and to stay healthy in order to carry out all his projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, metal sheets, beams and others) to continue to build an extra room and living room in his house.

loans.name: Sara

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, vivem na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Sara is married and the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend School. They live in their own house and she doesn't support anyone else.

She is a trader and owns her own business selling basic products. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future Sara hopes to complete her house and improve her commercial establishment. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to stay healthy in order to carry out all of her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
Loyda, tiene 52 años, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos de 36 y 34 años respectivamente , actualmente vive sola y  trabaja para asegurar su vejez cómoda y tranquila.
Loyda, se dedica a la venta de productos agropecuarios Realiza su actividad en diversos mercados de la ciudad. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos para el consumo humano como gallinas, patos y cerdos y a la siembra de productos agrícolas como plátano, piña y diversos cítricos . Semanalmente selecciona los animales con el peso ideal para el consumo y los productos agrícolas que se encuentren en su punto óptimo de maduración para la venta. En ocasiones llegan compradores hasta su propia chacra en donde también realiza sus ventas. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años y le va muy bien.
Su trabajo le gusta porque sus productos logran venderse a buen precio además es una mujer independiente y espera seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho y consolidar así su economía. Ahora espera comprar su vehiculo de carga para que no siga gastando en el transporte de sus productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste apoyo financiero, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual . Con el monto solicitado comprará alimentos de gallinas, patos y cerdos para que sus animales consigan el peso adecuado para la venta en el tiempo ideal.
texts.en:
Loyda, 52 years old, is a widow and has two children who are 36 and 34 years old respectively. Currently she lives alone and works to ensure comfort and tranquility in her old age. 

Loyda makes a living selling farming and livestock products. She carries out this work in various markets in the city. She raises domesticated animals for human consumption such as roosters, ducks and pigs and sows agricultural products such as plantains, pineapples and various citrus fruits. Weekly, she selects animals with the ideal weight for consumption and the agricultural products at the optimum ripeness to sell. Sometimes buyers come to her farm where she also makes sales.

She has had this business for over 4 years and it is going very well for her. She likes her work because she is able to sell her products for a good price. Also she is an independent woman and hopes to continue working in the same way as she has done up to now and thus to make ends meet.

Now she hopes to buy a vehicle so she can stop spending money on the transportation of her products. At this opportunity she is requesting 1,000 soles. She is grateful for the opportunity and the trust placed in her to receive this financial support. On the other hand she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she will buy feed for roosters, ducks and pigs so the animals can gain adequate weight so they can be sold at the right time.

loans.use: to buy feed for farm animals

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Solteira e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e sustenta a mãe e mais um irmão que vivem com ela.
Trabalha como empacotadora de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas, aros, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e continuar com os estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Helena is single and doesn't have any children. She lives in her own house and supports her mother and a brother who live with her.

She works as banana packer. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, rings,beams and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future Helena wishes to complete her house and continue with her studies. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is the lack of funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, rings,beams and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions and cooking condiments.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. Ей 41 год. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Дж.Руми в южной части Таджикистана. Муж Джамили занимается земледелием. Сама Джамила очень интересуется животноводством. Она хочет начать бизнес в этой сфере, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. К тому же в местности, где она живет климат и природа благоприятствует разведению скота. Джамила запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи мелко-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли с новой деятельности она планирует провести празднество по случаю обрезания младшего сына.
texts.en: Jamila is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. She and her family live in the J. Rumy region in the southern part of Tajikistan. Her husband grows crops for a living, while Jamila is interested in getting into animal husbandry. She wants to start a business in this area because it is profitable and does not require a great deal of physical labour. In addition, the climate where she lives is conducive to raising animals. Jamila is seeking a loan to buy livestock. She plans to use the profit generated by this loan to hold a ceremony for the circumcision of her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weatherproof her home

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém além dos seus filhos.
É electricista e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra do murro de vedação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir o murro e construir dependências para aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento devido do empréstimo para poder adquirir outros.
texts.en:
Armando is married and the father of 3 children who attend school. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.

He's an electrician and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue building the wall around his home.

In future Armando hopes to complete the wall and build rooms to rent out. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to pay off the loan so as to obtain others.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue building the wall around his home.

loans.name: Msamaria Group

texts.en:
Msamaria Group is located in Kakamega District. It is a group of 16 women and 9 men led by Rose, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for 0.5 acres of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Rose first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Rose joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Rose reports that, before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 15 bags of maize per 1.5 acres, but with her One Acre Fund input loan, during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 17 bags per 1.5 acres! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps to invest in another business. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Msamaria Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum, and sweet potato.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the wiring in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Nafisatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Nafisatu.  She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 10 years. 

In 2005, Nafisatu established her slippers business. She began her business after she decided to quit her job. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

Nafisatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of slippers for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her stock level and gain more profit. 

In the future, Nafisatu plans to educate her children up to university, build houses and become a supplier of slippers to other retailers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita, de 52 años de edad, está casada con Abel y juntos tienen una hija de 19 años quien es su principal motivo para esforzarse día a día y así brindarle lo mejor , los tres viven en una casa de su propiedad construida con material noble. Anita se dedica a la venta de cultivos agrícolas por está razón trabaja en su chacra en donde ha instalado un pequeño vivero y ahí acondiciona todos los cultivos que produce. Su labor consiste en preparar adecuadamente el sustrato que usa para el llenado de bolsas en donde luego siembra la semilla de cítricos, plantas ornamentales, frutales y otros. Los productos que pone a la venta son usados para trabajos de ornamentación o para producción agrícola en chacras o proyectos de agro-forestería. Lleva en esta actividad más de 5 años y lo hace con el apoyo de su hija y de 3 obreros más. 
Lo que le gusta de está actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar, se siente cómoda y contenta porque desarrolla la actividad que le fascina, lo que le desagrada es el intenso calor que origina muchas veces algunas pérdidas de cultivo , más adelante espera tener un vivero tecnificado donde produzca mayor cantidad de productos.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles , se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que tendrá para avanzar con su negocio , por eso se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará bolsas agricolas para almácigo, sustrato y semillas de plantas agrícolas para que continúe realizando su labor.
texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old.  She is married to Abel and they have a 19 year old daughter who is the main reason they strive day by day.  In this way, they can offer her the best.  The three live in their own home, built of quality material.  Anita is engaged in selling agricultural crops.  For this reason, she works on her small farm where she has installed a small nursery and there, she prepares all the crops that she produces.  Her job is to properly prepare the soil used for filling bags where the seeds of citrus, ornamental plants, fruit trees, and others are later sown.  The items that she offers for sale are used for ornamental purposes, for agricultural production on small farms, or for agro-forestry projects.  She has been engaged in this activity for over five years and carries out her work with the help of her daughter and three additional workers.  

She enjoys this activity because it allows her to have an income which she uses to help her husband pay the household expenses. She feels comfortable and happy because she is doing an activity that fascinates her.  However, she dislikes the intense heat that often causes crop losses.  In the future, she hopes to have a technified nursery where she can produce a larger quantity of products.

At this time, she is requesting a loan of S/. 500 soles.  She is happy to have the financial support that she will have to advance her business and for this reason, she is committed to making her payments on time.  With the amount requested, she will purchase agricultural bags for the nursery, soil, and seeds in order to continue performing her job.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural bags for the nursery, soil, and seeds.

loans.name: Ilsia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ilsia tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañada y  tiene cuatro hijos. Ella desea iniciar con el negocio de elaboración y venta de pupusas; tiene poca experiencia pero son mas los deseos de superación. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una plancha para elaborar las pupusas, el negocio lo instalara es su casa.
texts.en:
Ilsia, 35, is married and has four children.  She wants to start a business making and selling pupusas.  She doesn't have much experience but she does want to improve herself.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a griddle to make pupusas.  She's going to set up the business in her house.

loans.use: to buy a griddle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Irma Consuelo

texts.es:
Irma tiene 65 años de edad, esta  casada. Desde hace 10 años, es operario de un molino de nixtamal en su comunidad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para construir una vivienda para su hijo. Ella necesita terminar la casa para su hijo y su familia. Dentro de sus planes esta comprar un nuevo molino para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma, 65, is married.  She has operated a corn mill in her community for 10 years.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy construction materials to build a house for her son.  She needs to finish the house for her son and his family.

One of her plans is to buy a new mill to get more income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a house for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Bernard.  He is married and has 2 children aged 22 and 6 years. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him for schooling.

In 2008, Bernard established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to help with the smooth running of his home. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are people in the general community. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Bernard requires a loan in order to buy more drugs, cosmetics, etc., for resale. He hopes that this loan will help his business to grow through proper use.

In the future, Bernard plans to build a hospital, a house and to give a quality education to his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more of his medicine for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 44 años de edad,está casada con Pedro quien es el padre de sus 5 hijos, todos viven en su casa propia la cual construyeron hace mucho tiempo .Vilma se dedica a la siembra y venta de plátanos por está razón tiene una chacra en donde siembra principalmente este fruto, además de papaya, maíz y otros frutos de corto periodo vegetativo. Generalmente cosecha de manera semanal y una vez obtenido la cantidad necesaria traslada todo hasta el puerto fluvial en donde vende por racimos a precios al por mayor. Lleva en esta actividad mas de 11 años y por fortuna desde que empezó le ha ido muy bien aunque reconoce que tuvo que pasar algunos meses para que se acostumbre a la rutina laboral. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y de algunos obreros que contrata dependiendo de la magnitud del trabajo a realizar. 
Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es la rentabilidad que obtiene por sus ventas, ya que este producto es muy cotizado y solicitado por la población, además al complementarlo con otros productos sus ganancias económicas son siempre favorecidas. Planea obtener un puesto de ventas en algún mercado de la ciudad en donde pueda vender por unidades para ganar aún más. 
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para alquilar un puesto de ventas en el mercado principal de su localidad para que continúe vendiendo diversos productos regionales , principalmente plátanos, además está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio y seguir creciendo personalmente.
texts.en:
Vilma, 44, is married to Pedro, the father of her five children.  They all live in her own house, which they built a long time ago.

Vilma makes a living growing and selling bananas.  This is why she has a farm where she plants primarily this fruit along with papaya, corn, and other short-season fruit.  Normally she harvests weekly, and once she has the necessary quantity she takes everything to the river port where she sells it wholesale by the bunch.

She has had this job for 11 years and fortunately it has gone very well for her since the beginning, although it did take her several months to get used to the work routine.  She works with the help of her husband and some laborers she hires, depending on how much work there is to do.

What she likes about her job is the profit she gets from her sales, because this product is highly valued and requested by the community.  Also, by selling it along with other products her earnings are always good.  She plans to get a sales stall in some market in the city where she can sell retail and earn even more.

Currently she's going to request 500 soles [PEN] to rent a sales stall in the main market of her town so she can continue selling a variety of regional products, primarily bananas.

She's happy to know she has financial support that will let her get ahead with her business and continue to grow personally.

loans.use: to rent a sales stall

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly, de 40 años, esta casada con Leonilde quien es el padre de sus 3 hijas y junto a toda su familia vive en su casa propia luchando a diario para salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida.Roly, tiene como actividad principal la venta de esteras por está razón tiene instalado un taller rudimentario de fabricación de este producto y continuamente elabora la cantidad necesaria para poder venderlos. Generalmente sus ventas son hechas por pedidos anticipados cuya cantidad en volumen siempre favorece su economía. La materia prima lo obtiene de lugares cercanos quienes le ofrecen a precios cómodos los restos de madera que recicla para confeccionar las esteras. Todo el proceso de fabricación es manual. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 4 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y un obrero más.Le apasiona el trabajo que realiza porque siente que con ello contribuye a la conservación del medio ambiente, además le agrada saber que con esta labor puede obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para los gastos básicos de su familia. Espera poder implementar un taller semi-industrial donde elabore esteras de mejor acabado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de clavos pequeños, pegamentos y restos de madera que usa para elaborar esteras , además está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Roly, 40, is married to Leonilde, the father of her three daughters.  The whole family lives together in her own house, striving every day to get ahead and improve their standard of living.

Roly's job is selling mats, for which she has set up a rudimentary workshop to make this product.  She continuously makes the quantity she needs to sell.  Generally her sales are made on advance orders in quantity, which benefits her budget.  She gets her raw materials from nearby locations where they offer her affordable prices for the wood remainders that she recycles to make the mats.  The entire production process is manual.

She has been in this business for about four years and she works with the help of her husband and one other worker.  She's passionate about her work because she feels that with it she contributes to the conservation of the environment.  It also pleases her to know that with this job she can get the income she needs for her family's basic expenses.  She hopes to be able to set up a semi-industrial shop to make mats with better finishing touches.

Currently she's requesting 1000 soles [PEN] to buy small nails, glue, and wood remainders that she needs to make mats.

She's happy knowing she has financial support because she'll feel more certain of getting ahead with her job.  She also pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy nails, glue, and wood remainders

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 62 años de edad, está divorciada y es madre soltera de 2 hijos ,con quienes vive en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Teresa es la venta de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos de frutas, lo cual lo realiza en un espacio dentro de su hogar, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención. Dedicándose al mismo tiempo a la venta de ropas de segundo mano, los cuales compras en los centros comerciales de su ciudad, para venderlos entre sus vecinas.Lleva dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 02 años, lo cual lo realiza con la ayuda de su hija y lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera ya que puede apoyar a su familia con los gastos  de su hogar . Por otro lado vende sus bebidas gasificadas y comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo por los pobladores de su localidad, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio  y mejorar su local.
Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de  S/.800 nuevo soles comprará esencias de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos, bebidas gasificadas  y ropa de segunda mano .
texts.en:
Sixty-two-year-old Teresa is a divorced mother of two children, whom she lives with in her own home.  Teresa sells carbonated drinks and fruit sodas for a living, which she does in a space in her home.  She has attracted many customers with her good service.  She also sells second-hand clothes, which she buys in her city's shopping centers to sell to her neighbors.  She has been in this business for over two years.  She does the work with her daughter and what she likes about her business is the financial income it generates, as it allows her to help her family with the household expenses.  She also sells her carbonated drinks and she tells us that she cannot lose with that business because it is a product that is pretty popular with the people who live in her town.  For this reason, she has plans to make her business grow and to improve her shop.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to rely on to make progress with her business.  This is why she promises to make her payments on time.

With the requested 800 soles, she will buy fruit extracts to make her soft drinks, carbonated drinks, and second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks, fruit extracts, and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Sama. She is married and has three children, ages 28, 30, and 31 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her as sales assistants. 

In 2009, Sama established her rice business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of herself. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are general community people. Working seven days per week and 12 hours per day, Sama earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sama requires a loan in order to increase her stock level by buying more bags of rice for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her and that it will increase her profit margin. In the future, Sama plans to finish her bakery, as it is another way of getting income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To constructhis dairy unit.

loans.name: Maira Suyapa

texts.es:
Maira, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos, vive en una aldea cercana que pertenece al municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Maira, es muy trabajadora, ella tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse al comercio y a la agricultura. Produce y vende café y banano. También vende comida en la escuela que está cerca a su casa. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo de 6,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para la finca de café y banano, espera que esta inversión le ayude a  incrementar la producción de cafe . Su sueño es trabajar mucho con su finca, darle el mantenimiento adecuado para tener una fuente de ingresos seguro y lograr una independencia económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maira is 36 years old, lives with her long-term partner, and has two children.  She lives in a nearby town that belongs to the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Maira is very hardworking; she has been working in trade and farming for over ten years.  She grows and sells coffee and bananas.  She also sells food at the school that is close to her home.  She is asking for a second loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for her coffee and banana farm.  She hopes that this investment will help her increase her coffee production.  Her dream is to work on her farm a lot and give it the maintenance it needs to have a reliable source of income and achieve financial independence for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee and banana farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more of her clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña Guapa está empezando a trabajar dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Están en su primer ciclo, donde cada una demuestra tener ansias de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marlene,  quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas, y en lo que le va muy bien ya que sus clientes siempre están a gusto con lo que ella prepara. Su sueño es poder tener un gran comedor para poder seguir haciendo ricas comidas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, como ser: carnes, verduras, condimentos, etc.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Group is starting to work with the foundation's enterprising women program.  They are in their first loan cycle and each of them is itching to get ahead and help each other out.

One of the members is Marlene, who sells different kinds of prepared foods and who is doing well, as her customers always likes what she makes.  Her dream is to have a huge kitchen so she can keep making delicious food.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients so she can keep making the foods she sells, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres de este grupo, todas ellas luchadoras y emprendedoras, que quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Están en el quinto ciclo y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de comités.
