Heliodora forma parte de este grupo, ella comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de productos, como ser cartones, aluminio, plásticos, y demás materiales, que ella recoge en forma ambulante todos los días desde muy temprano. Luego ella los vende y de esa forma tiene un ingreso que la ayuda a mantener a su familia. También ella compra algunos materiales y los revende. Heliodora está muy orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de plásticos y aluminio, que ella revenderá y luego tendrá un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
There are 19 women in this group, all of whom are enterprising fighters who want to get ahead and help their families.  They are in their fifth loan cycle and they want to reach the highest level of the communal bank program.  

Heliodora is a part of this group.  She tells us that her business is recycling all sorts of products, such as cardboard, aluminum, plastic, and other materials that she collects on foot every day starting very early.  She then sells them, which provides her with an income that helps her support her family.  She also buys some materials and then resells them.  Heliodora is very proud of what she does, as it is decent, honest work.

She is asking for this loan to buy plastics and aluminum, which she will resell for a little more profit.

loans.use: to buy plastic and aluminum for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mark.  He is married and has four children aged three, seven, nine and thirteen. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to assist a late brother's children with their education.  

In 1997, Mark established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant and be able to cater to the needs of the family. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are gentlemen and office workers. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,940,000 every month from this business. 

Mark would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mark has already received and successfully repaid four loans. He requires the new loan in order to purchase four bales of office jackets and two bales of trousers. He hopes that this loan will help by increasing the stock. In the future, Mark plans to see the business grow and hopes to move to a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's jackets and trousers

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Binta. She is a widow and has three children, aged 22, 19 and 11. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is her relative.  

In 1994, Binta established her foodstuff, beverages and drinks business. She began her business by selling drinks to passengers traveling to Freetown. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,837,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Binta has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, ovaltine and sugar. In the future, Binta plans to build a house and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for foodstuff, beverages and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Aminata. She is married and has one child aged two. In 2002, Aminata established her cooking utensils business. The business was started to help her husband, who is a student, to run the affairs of their home. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Aminata earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 5,000,000. 

Aminata has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional kitchen utensils. In the future, Aminata plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town and hopes to take care of the needs of the family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a father of two children aged six and four years and has been in active farming in his rural home for twenty years where he produces mainly maize and beans for the local market. Farming is the source of income though supplemented with a retail business he runs in the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a dairy unit and buy a chuff-cutter. He believes he will earn enough income to enable him educate his children as well as improve the general living standards of the family.

Peter says lack of adequate capital and animal diseases are the greatest challenge smallholder farmers have.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy a chuff-cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and fumigation sprays for her fields of potatoes, broccoli and cauliflower

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Bernarda es comerciante hace mas de 5 años tiene en su propia casa una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja con su esposo, el Sr. Ramón, con quien está casada  hace más de 20 años el mismo es jubilado y percibe sueldo del estado. 
Bernarda no se queja de sus ventas  ya que tiene muchos clientes todo el día porque  al lado de su negocio hay dos talleres  grandes y llega mucha gente. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por seguir trabajando.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de prendas y artículos de mercería, para poder implementar más productos a su despensa, y así para poder atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a shopkeeper.  For over five years, she has had a well-stocked convenience store in her home where she works with her husband, Ramón.  She and Ramón have been married for over 20 years.  He is retired and receives a state pension.

Bernarda has no complaints about her sales, as she has plenty of customers all day because there are two big workshops next-door to her business and many people stop by.  She is a very hardworking person who pushes to keep working.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothing and notions so she will have more products in her store, which will attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and notions, such as pans, shoes, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a mother of four adult children and is involved in active farming in her rural home area in Central Kenya. Her farm produce, which includes tea, bananas, vegetables and milk is sold within the local market. In addition to farming, she runs a cereals retail business within the local market.

Zipporah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy sheep.This she says will help her maximize her farming business and improve her living standards with the income generated. She believes she will eventually start a dairy farming business.

She says her main challenges are pests and diseases.She is determined to fully use Juhudi Kilimo's loan facility.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a rice retailing and general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries and sacks of rice to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries and sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni works hard to support her family. Laarni is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Laarni requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Laarni has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Laarni would like to repair and renovate her family home and save enough to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Leah is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, noodles, snack foods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mansueta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to raise and feed.

Mansueta has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store and rice-retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise and feed.

loans.name: Richael

texts.en:
Richael is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buying and selling charcoal business.

Richael has been in this business for five years. Richael earns additional income from general store and selling gasoline.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buying and selling charcoal, general store and selling gasoline business.

Richael has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 71 years old and married, with ten children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming sugarcane for 49 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres son las que forman este grupo de Villa Ygatimi, están en su primer ciclo, donde cada una está con gran entusiasmo por crecer y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias.
Todas se dedican a la cría y venta, como así también la faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás. Una de ellas es Maria, y ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y demás insumos para poder seguir criando a sus animales.
Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo, ya que les ayuda no solo a ellas, sino también a sus familias.
texts.en:
There are ten women who form the Villa Ygatimi group.  They are in their first cycle.  Each one of them is very enthusiastic about growing and getting ahead in order to help their families. They all raise and sell animals and poultry like chickens, pigs, goats, and the rest.  

Maria is one of the members.  She is requesting the loan in order to be able to buy balanced feed and other supplies to continue raising her animals.

They are grateful for the opportunity that all of them are receiving.  It not only helps them, but it also helps their families.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Magnolia works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and directly selling Avon products.

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, all since repaid. She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 20000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rica works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rica is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell in her vegetable-vending business.

Rica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable-vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.ru: Шухратчон житель города Турсунзаде, находящийся в центрально-западной части Таджикистана. У него жена и четверо детей. Жена Шухратчон не работает, она ведет домашнее хозяйство, а дети несовершеннолетние. Как видно Шухратчон единственный кормилец семьи. Он обеспечивает семью занимаясь выпечкой. У него имеется пекарня, где он выпекает лепёшки. Шухратчон занимается выпечкой уже 15 лет и имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Сейчас Шухратчон хочет расширить свою деятельность. Он просит кредит для закупа муки для выпечки большого количества лепёшки. За счет прибыли в дальнейшем он планирует открыть еще одну пекарню.
texts.en:
Shuhratjon is an inhabitant of the town of Turson-zoda, located in the central-western part of Tajikistan. He has a wife and four children. Shuhratjon's wife is not working; she runs the domestic household and the children are minors. As can be seen, Shuhratjon is the sole breadwinner for the family. 

He provides for the family by engaging in baking. He has a bakery, where he bakes flatbreads. Shuhratjon has been engaged as a baker for 15 years and has extensive experience in this sphere. Shuhratjon now wants to expand its activities. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase flour for baking a large number of flatbreads. He plans to use profits to open a bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour for baking flatbreads

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.ru: Абдушукуру 29 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Он со своей семьей живет в городе Турсунзаде в центрально-западной части Таджикистана. Его жена домохозяйка, так как дети маленькие. Абдушукур один обеспечивает семью. Он работает в пекарне лепешечником. Абдушукур занимается выпечкой уже 4 года и за эти годы приобрел достаточный опыт. Чтобы увеличить производство лепешки, Абдушукур обратился за кредитом. Он берет кредит для закупа муки для выпечки лепешки.
texts.en:
Abdushukur is 29 years old. He is married and the father of four children. He and his family live in the town of Tursun-zoda in the central-western part of Tajikistan. His wife is a homemaker since the children are still small. 

Abdushukur provides for the family on his own. He works in a bakery as a flatbread-maker. Abdushukur has been engaged as a baker for four years and over the years has acquired sufficient experience.

In order to expand production of flatbreads, Abdushukur applied for a loan. He is taking a loan to buy flour for baking flatbreads.

loans.use: to purchase flour for baking flatbreads

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 62 años, está casada con Ángel y vive en su casa propia junto a su hija y su yerno .El trabajo de Felicita consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi , por está razón acuden a su casa dos conductores quienes se encargan de hacer circular sus vehículos por las principales calles de la ciudad, por dicho alquiler recibe un monto económico el cual le ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar, pero para eso su herramienta de trabajo debe estar en óptimas condiciones , está actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años.Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite principalmente dedicar su tiempo libre a otras actividades, esto le permite mejorar su nivel de vida, al principio le fue muy complicado por que no conocía mucho del negocio al cual incursionaba pero con el tiempo fue mejorando sus capacidades y ahora se siente tranquila por todo lo que está consiguiendo y espera en un futuro poder comprarse otro mototaxi y poco a poco consolidar una gran empresa vehicular.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para la compra de un par de llantas y repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para que funcione mejor, además se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que le ayudará a mejorar su herramienta de trabajo .
texts.en:
Felicita, 62, is married to Ángel and lives in her own house with her daughter and her son-in-law.

Felicita's job is renting motorcycle taxis.  Two drivers who go to her house are responsible for driving her vehicles on the main streets of the city.  As rent she receives an amount that helps her cover some of the household necessities.  For this, though, her working tool has to be in optimal condition.  She has done this job for four years.

She likes her job because it allows her to mainly devote her free time to other activities, in turn improving her standard of living.  In the beginning it was very complicated because she wasn't very familiar with the business she was getting into, but in time she improved her skills and now she has nothing to worry about because of everything she's getting.  She hopes to buy another motorcycle taxi in the future and little by little establish a great vehicle company. 

Currently she's going to request 500 soles [PEN] to buy a pair of tires and parts she needs for her motorcycle taxi to run better.

She's happy about the financial support she's getting because it will help her improve her work tool.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle taxi parts and tires

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 55 years old and married, with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for laborers' salaries for the cultivation of land and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

Alma has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for the cultivation of land and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling nipa, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction.  Corazon is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other materials for the fishing business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through nine past loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita is a loveable mother. She is 45 years old, married and has four children who attend school. She married to a farmer, and to supplement his income, she operates a daily buy and sell business for fruits and vegetables. She sells to the people in her village. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy more vegetables to sell such as eggplant, cabbage, squash, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and bitter melon.  This will increase her sales capacity, and will enable her to save as well. She wants to keep extending fresh products and gracious services to all her customers.  

Roselita would like to continuously grow, in terms of financial matters, to provide a good education to her children. This is the best heritage she can provide.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell such as eggplant, cabbage, squash, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and bitter melon.

loans.name: Nurillo

texts.ru: Нурилло 50 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат и отец шестерых детей. Он со своей семьей живет в Яванском районе в центральной части Таджикистана. Нурилло занимается садоводством уже в течение 6 лет. У него имеется 1га земли, где он выращивает виноград и он работает в своем саду на водовозной машине. В ведении садоводства ему помогает семья. Нурилло запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и топлива с целью обработки грядок винограда.
texts.en:
Nurillo is 50 years old. He has a large family. He is married and the father of six children. He and his family lives in the Yavan region in the central part of Tajikistan. 

Nurillo has been engaged in gardening for the course of six years already. He has one hectare of land where he grows grapes and he works a hay machine in his garden. In managing his gardening, he is helped by his family. 

Nurillo is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel for the purpose of processing grape beds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel with the aim of processing grape beds

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. Ей 37 лет. Она живет со своей семьей в районе Хуросон. В данный момент ее муж и старший сын находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Мукаддас намерена начать свой бизнес. Ей интересна животноводческая деятельность - купля и продажа крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет закупить коров и телят, откармливать их несколько месяцев и продавать их с наценкой на скотном рынке. С этим намерением Мукаддас обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Muqaddas is a married woman with four children. She is 37 years old. She lives with her family in the Khuroson region. At this time, her husband and eldest son are working abroad. 

Muqaddas intends to start her own business. She is interested in livestock activities - buying and selling cattle. She wants to buy cows and cattle, to fatten them up for several months and selling them at a premium at the cattle market. 

With this intention, Muqaddas applied for a loan. She is requesting a loan to buy and sell cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Apolonia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Cristina is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing business, like paint, wood, fishing net, etc.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing business, like paint, wood, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Faizirahmon

texts.ru: Файзирахмон житель города Кургантюбе, расположенный на юге Таджикистана. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Его родители пенсионеры. Сам Файзирахмон совместно с женой занимается земледелием и выращивает в основном овощи. Сейчас Файзирахмон хочет одновременно заняться новым бизнесом. Он планирует приобрести новый вид мотороллера и заняться перевозкой грузов. Во время сбора своего урожая, он будет перевозить на рынок свой товар, а в другое время будет предоставлять свои услуги на мотороллере. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для приобретения мотороллера. За счет прибыли он хочет устроить торжество по случаю обрезания своего сына.
texts.en:
Faizirahmon is an inhabitant of the town of Qurgan-Tube, located in the south of Tajikistan. He is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. His parents are retired. 

Faizirahmon and his wife themselves are engaged in agriculture and grow mainly vegetables. Now, Faizirahmon wants to start a new business at the same time. He plans to purchase a new type of scooter and to engage in transporting cargo. While collecting their harvest, he will transported the product to the market, and at other times he will provide his services on the scooter. To this end, he is requesting a loan to purchase a scooter. 

With the profit, he wants to arrange a celebration on the occasion of the circumcision of his son.

loans.use: to purchase a scooter

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is 51 years old and is married, with three children. She is selling grocery items in the village to produce income. 

Lenita is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toothpaste, candies, and eggs. She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to increase her stocks and be able to save money for future use. 

In the future, Lenita would like to start another source of income, such as hog-fattening. She just hopes that her sari-sari business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toothpaste, candies and eggs for her sari-sari business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith works hard to support her family. Edith is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Edith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Edith has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Edith would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como operário numa empresa de produção de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, aros, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a obra da sua casa e iniciar um negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para aumentar a sua renda mensal e realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Luis is married and has three children who attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He works as a laborer for a banana production company. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, rocks, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish the construction in his house and to start a business. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working harder in order to increase his monthly income and accomplish all his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, rocks, window frames, etc.).

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 46 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a cable installation business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional units and materials for her business. Erlinda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional units and materials for her business

loans.name: Almirante

texts.pt:
Solteiro e pai de 1 filha ainda menor de idade, vive na casa da sua irmã e não sustenta mais ninguém além da sua filha.
É polícia e tem um negócio de criação de frangos para revenda. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja concluir a obra da sua casa e oficializar a sua relação, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para aumentar o volume de criação e solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Almirante is single and has a daughter who's still underage. He lives in his sister's house and doesn't support anyone else other than his daughter.
He's a police officer and owns a business raising chickens for selling. With the current loan he intends to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the number of chickens he raises.
His wish for the future is to finish building his house and make his relationship official. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working harder in order to raise a larger number of animals and apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa está en su ciclo número 1, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y son las que más se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
Aurelia mostró en su ultima encuentra estar en el nivel uno de la encuesta de eliminación, eso la motiva a trabajar más, para poder mejorar su economía y la de su familia. Tiene una pequeña despensa que es el sustento de su familia y en la que trabaja desde muy temprano todos los días.
Aurelia solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceite, huevos, azúcar, leche, fideos y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named Santa Rosa is in their first cycles.  They are making an effort to eliminate poverty, for two of them find themselves living below the poverty line, and they are the ones pushing themselves the hardest to get ahead.

Aurelia showed herself to be at the first level of this survey, and this motivated her to work more to improve her economic situation and that of her family.  She has a small grocery which provides the livelihood for her family and in which she works from the early hours of each day.

Aurelia requested this loan to invest in the purchase of oil, eggs, sugar, milk, noodles, and other items to continue her sales and offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, sugar, milk, noodles, and more.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Señor Felix es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene  hijos  y comenta que es dueño de una despensa que el mismo atiende, además de eso su señora se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder mantener a los hijos.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, comenta que empezó a trabajar como quinielero recorría todo los días por la zona de Santaní, el señor siempre soñaba de tener una despensa bien surtida para poder ayudar más a su familia. Ahora ya cuenta con su propio negocio cuenta con clientela formada con buen ingreso.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, fideos, arroz, leche y demás insumos para poder seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felix is from the city of Santaní and has children.  He reports that he is the owner and operator of a small grocery store.  Additionally, his wife sells fast food, so together they are able to support their children.

He is a very hardworking, responsible and honest man.  He mentions that he started out running football pools, travelling every day around Santaní.  He always dreamed of having a well-stocked store in order to better support his family.  Now he has his own business with an established customer base and a good income.

He is seeking this loan in order to buy rice, noodles, milk, beverages and other items.  This will enable him to continue to offer a good variety of items to his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, milk, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Ermenda

texts.en: Ermenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of spices and vegetables to sell for her business. Ermenda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of spices and vegetable to sell

loans.name: Heidy

texts.en: As a married parent of 5 children, Heidy works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Heidy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É guarda e tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, blocos, cimento, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e investir no seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Alexandre is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a security guard and owns his own business selling various products. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (rocks, bricks, cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish the construction of his house and to invest in his business. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is not having enough funds to accomplish all his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (rocks, bricks, cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É investigador criminal e quadro do Ministério do interior. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, estribos, cimento, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e iniciar um negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é continuar com os estudos e incentivar os filhos a estudar e se formar.
texts.en:
Jonas is married and has two children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a criminal investigator and a staffer of the Ministry of the Interior. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (sand, skirting boards, cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish the construction of his house and to start a business. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is moving forward with his studies and encouraging his children to study and get a degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, skirting boards, cement, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Hernalyn

texts.en: Hernalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothing to sell. Hernalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 31 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns some income from buying and selling charcoal.  Judy has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, eggs, bread, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Faroles De Esperanza 7 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, Faroles de Esperanza 7 ("lanterns of hope"). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Maritza makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling miscellaneous products, specially clothes and shoes. She will use this loan to buy jeans, skirts, shirts, cosmetic products, shoes, etc. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business.

Maritza is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid a previous loan and grown her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics, sandals, accesories and other products

loans.name: Herculano

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É mecânico e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, barrotes, cimento, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e legalizar um terreno para o seu filho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais angariar fundos para pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Herculano is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a mechanic. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (sand, beams, cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish the construction of his house and to buy the title to a plot of land for his son. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working harder and gathering funds to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, beams, cement, iron, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Hilda no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Odontología, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Hilda trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para bebés y lencería, adicionalmente los fines de semana vende bebidas y raspadillas en las playas de su ciudad, 
Hilda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera Hilda podrá seguir trabajando y atendiendo a sus clientes, así pues ella desea lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 33 year old woman, who lives in the city of Pisco with her two children, who she loves and considers to be her main reason for living.  She is a very likable person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who dedicates all of her efforts to helping her family get ahead in life, since she acts as both father and mother to her children.  Sadly, due to her lack of financial resources, and because of her need to work from a very young age, Hilda was not able to study for a career in Dentistry.  In her free time, she likes to cook a delicious Ceviche (seasoned seafood in lime juice) to share with her family.

Of her own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Hilda works at her own small business selling baby clothing and underwear, and also on the weekends, she sells drinks and slushies on the beaches of her city.

Hilda is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva, thanks to their help she will be able to buy a small place of business in the central market in her city.  In this way, Hilda will be able to continue working and attending to her customers' needs.  Thus, she will become able to achieve her great dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy a place of business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years, and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, eggs, etc. Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Loningning

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Loningning works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Loningning is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, wood, etc. for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be hard-working. She operates a food retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a favorable business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Susan will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fingerlings (small fish to stock her pond). Her business goal is to construct more fish ponds for fish farming  within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en: Babylyn sells crabs. In her business she works with her husband. They are helping each other to advance their lives. Now, she is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy crabs and shrimps for sale. Hopefully, her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy crabs and shrimp for sale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children, 4 years old and 9 years old. He describes himself to be a creative man. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a busy market  and his primary customers are local residents and restaurants.

Geoffrey describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy charcoal to sell. His business goal is to be independent in his business within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to repay a previous loan of Kes 80,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy charcoal  to sell

loans.name: Daina

texts.en: Daina is a business-minded mother who dreams of growing her business. She is selling shoes and slippers in the market. This is helping her family to set up their living situation, but insufficient capital is a big problem in her business operation.  For this matter, Daina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 for additional working capital in her business. It will be used to buy footwear such as slippers and shoes. She hopes that her loan will provide her greater profits in order to enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: to buy footwear such as slippers and shoes

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She runs a sari-sari store where she sells snacks, biscuits, soft drinks and spices. She has been in this business for over four years and has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional goods to stock in her store such as eggs, cooking oil, noodles, bath soap and detergent. She works hard to provide for her family. This is the only source of income she has because she was not be able to finish her college education.

loans.use: to stock more items in her store such as eggs, cooking oil, noodles, bath soap and detergent

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is 43 years old, married and works hard to help her husband. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marieta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase paint, wood, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat. Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase paint, wood, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 57-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a general retail business where she sells eggs, fruit, and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital for expanding her business. 

Annah will use the Kes 14,000 loan to pay school fees for her three  grandchildren whom she takes care of. Her business goal is to run her business in permanent business premises within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her grandchildren

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar,  soap, bread, milk, and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Kuña Pora Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pora Renda está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y quieren salir adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus hijos y por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, hace todo tipo de minutas, como ser sándwich, empanadas, y demás. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre recibe muchos pedidos. Con su trabajo y su esfuerzo está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma están saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, jamón, queso, condimentos y demás para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora Renda group is on its sixth cycle.  Everyone in the women’s group works and wants to move forward. They are women who are heads of their households who fight for their children and for their families. 
One of the group members is Juana who sells food. She makes all types of quick foods like sandwiches, empanadas and other items. She has a very good clientele since she always receives lots of orders. With her work and her efforts, she is giving her family everything they need. With this work, she is moving forward. 
She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, meat, ham, cheese, condiments and other products in order to continue making the foods that she sells.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, meat, ham, cheese, condiments and other products.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a 36-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking an additional loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Pascal started selling lights in June, 2011, and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is a 29-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Celestin started selling lights in July, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Jeannette and to enable him to invest in the education of his two children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Angel Smith

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Angel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angel trabaja brindando servicios de seguridad en una empresas de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Angel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que él y sus hermanos duermen una sola habitación, la cual se encuentra deteriorada y Angel desea brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y así poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Angel is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who strives to do his best in all areas of life. Unfortunately, since he grew up in a family of scarce resources, Angel has always needed to work to make ends meet and was never able to pursue the university degree of his dreams, Mechanical Engineering. In his free time, Angel likes to play soccer with his friends and cook delicious Chaufa Rice for his family.

Through his own initiative, and with lots of hard work and dedication, Angel has found work for himself as a security guard for various businesses around the city. He works 10 hours every day, and he believes that work is going well because he is very responsible and treats everyone he meets with kindness and respect.

Angel is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and he plans to use the funds from this loan to complete a construction project to add a room onto his house. Presently, he and his siblings all sleep in one small, dilapidated room in their house. Angel hopes to build a safer room for his siblings with this project and to improve their quality of life. His future plans are to continue working at his current jobs, and he hopes to one day be able to pursue a university degree and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to complete a construction project to add a room onto his house.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of frozen and processed products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 21,000 PHP loan to buy different processed and frozen foods like hotdogs, ham, stuffed meat and more. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional frozen and processed foods like hot dogs, ham, stuffed meat and other products for her business.

loans.name: Marily

texts.es: Marily, de 50 años de edad, esta casada con Niel quien es padre de sus 6 hijos , pero actualmente vive con su última hija en su humilde casa construida con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Marily es la venta de dulces de hielo conocidos en su ciudad como chupetes además de bebidas gasificadas y helados de marcas reconocidas y de exquisito sabor. Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, ahí conserva a bajas temperaturas todos los productos que ofrece para que siempre estén refrescantes y al gusto del cliente. En la mañanas prepara todo lo necesario usando frutas regionales de calidad y los vende por las tardes en los parques o colegios cercanos a su vivienda usando envases refrigerantes. Inició su trabajo hace 2 años y desde entonces lo realiza sola.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y descansar sin presión alguna, además puede contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios para pagar los gastos básicos de su hogar aunque aveces la lluvia dificulta la venta de sus productos ella no se desanima desanima y  tiene planeado continuar con su negocio y aumentar la variedad de sus productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio , además asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas gasificas de diversas marcas y frutas para elaborar los deliciosos dulces de hielo que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Marily is 50 years old and is married to Niel, the father of her six children. She is currently living with her youngest daughter in the humble home they constructed through their efforts. 

Marily sells frozen treats which are known as "chupetes" in her city as well as soft drinks and delicious and popular brands of ice cream. In order to do so, she has a refrigerator which she bought with her savings. The refrigerator stores all of the products that she offers at a low temperature so that they are always refreshing and to the customer's liking. In the mornings she prepares all of the necessary items using quality regional fruits. In the afternoons she uses refrigerated containers to sell her products in parks or schools near her home. 

She started this job two years ago and has worked alone ever since. She likes her business because it allows her to remain at home and to rest without any pressure, as well as providing the income necessary to cover her basic living expenses. Although sometimes rainfall makes it difficult for her to sell her products, she does not become discouraged. She plans to continue on in her business and to diversify her products.

On this occasion she is requesting 500 Peruvian soles. She is happy to know that she has the economic support that will enable her business to advance and progress. She also guarantees that she will be punctual in the repayment. 

With the amount she has requested she will buy a variety of soft drinks and fruits to make the delicious frozen treats that she sells.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and fruit

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 22 años, está casada con Nilo y juntos tienen 2 hijas pequeñas,con quienes vive en su casa propia. Mónica se dedica a la venta de pasamanería. Su función se inicia con la adquisición de diferentes artículos como discos compactos musicales, ganchos, pilas, pañuelos, adornos, mentoles y otros , con todo lo obtenido recorre las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos esperando vender una cantidad considerable que le permita tener buenas ganancias. Su trabajo es ambulatorio y lo hace con ayuda de pareja. Lleva realizando esta actividad cerca de 4 años. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede recorrer las calles de la ciudad junto a su esposo trabajando y paseando a la vez, conoce nuevas personas y entabla nuevas relaciones que posteriormente se vuelven en clientes habituales. Está muy contenta por que gracias a este trabajo ha mejorado su economía familiar. Espera pronto tener un puesto de ventas fijo en algún mercado o en su casa para así vender mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, que le permite avanzar con su negocio.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará diferentes artículos femeninos como ganchos, pulseras, adornos y otros para que pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Monica, who is 22 years old, is married to Nilo, and together they have two little daughters, with whom they live in their own house. Monica's work is selling personal accessories. She began her work with the acquisition of various articles such as musical compact discs, hairpins, batteries, handkerchiefs, decorations, menthols, and other items. With everything she obtained, she went through the streets of the city, offering her products and hoping to sell a considerable quantity that would allow her to have good earnings. Her work is on foot, and she does it with the help of her husband. She has been doing this for about four years. 

What she likes about her work is that she can go through the streets of the city together with her husband, working and strolling at the same time. She knows new people, and she strikes up new relationships that later become regular customers. She is very happy because thanks to this work she has improved the family economy. She hopes to soon have a regular sales stall in some market or in her house, so that she can sell a greater quantity and variety of articles. At this time she is applying for 1000 PEN, and she feels grateful for the opportunity to have financial support, which allows her to advance with her business. With the loan that she has applied for, she will buy items for women such as hairpins, bracelets, decorations, and other items so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy hairpins, bracelets, decorations, and other products.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es: María, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. María, tiene su propio negocio en un local del mercado donde vende todo tipo de ropa, como camisas, camisetas, ropa intima, manteles y otros.  Lleva cuatro años de tener el negocio y ha visto buenos resultados. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar ropa para surtir su negocio y poder cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y brindar bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old. She is a single mother. She has three children and lives in a village in the township of Arizona, Atlántida. Maria has her own business in a location in the market where she sells every type of clothing, such as shirts, T-shirts, underwear, tablecloths, and other items. She has had this business for four years and has seen good results. She has decided to apply for a loan of 8000 lempiras, with which she is going to buy clothing to stock her business and to cover the orders of her customers. Her goal is to make her business grow to obtain better earnings and provide family well-being.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman who has two children aged nine months and six years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman.

For the past five years Annah has operated a stall from which she sells clothes to passersby. Her business is located in an established market. Customers’ lack of money at the beginning of the month is her biggest business challenge.

Annah is applying for a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy greater quantities of stock to sell. Her goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is a 30-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Francois started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 120 lights to date, providing clean energy to 600 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Beatrice, and their three children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has two children who are 2 years and 5 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a potential business area, and her primary customers are her daily regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough storage for charcoal to sell. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a general store where she sells item such as sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a competitive business area, and her primary customers are members of the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase sugar, salt and flour to sell. Her business goal is to run a well-established business within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and flour to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has two children and lives in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world - in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer - which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Eunice has been farming for three years and is currently growing maize and beans on her land. She likes working with Honey Care Africa because the field techs visit her farm regularly and do good work inspecting the hives. Eunice enjoys beekeeping because bees are easy to keep and don't require management.

Eunice plans to use the income generated from her hives to expand her farming activities, by planting fruit trees and keeping chickens. Her hope for the future is to be a role model to the community and empower them in farming.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey.

loans.name: Momanyi

texts.en:
Momanyi is a married man with two children, aged one and seven years. He describes himself as an innovative man.

Momanyi operates a retail business selling charcoal, a business he has been involved in for three years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances for improving the business. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy charcoal and pay for renting a store to sell from. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and pay for renting a store to sell it from.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kakamega county, in Western Kenya. The county is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Margaret has four children and is currently growing maize and bananas on her land. She likes keeping bees because it is easy and another source of income. She also enjoys working with Honey Care because "they don't just sell you the beehive, they deliver them to your farm."

In the future, Margaret hopes to live a better life. This is her first loan and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman with two children, aged two and eight years. She describes herself as an optimistic and hard-working woman. She operates a general store where she sells items such as sugar, rice, flour, eggs, soda, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a favorable business area and her primary customers are local residents. Pauline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances for improving the business. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice, salt, flour, etc. Her business goal is to run a well established general store within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Aland

texts.en:
Aland, 23, is married to Theresia, 23, and they are blessed with a four year old daughter, Jean.

The family's breadwinner, Aland works as a motor taxi driver. He works daily from 6am to 7pm. Unfortunately, his motorbike was damaged and it has now been one month that he cannot run his business. The situation affects his family's daily income.

Aland has thus requested a loan of 7,500,000 IDR from TLM to purchase gear, a motorcycle chain, and a motorcycle compass. He also plans to sell gasoline in front of his house. He hopes that he can generate more income by running other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase gear, a motorcycle chain, a motorcycle compass, and gasoline.

loans.name: Thersia

texts.en:
Thersia, 46, is married to Yahya, 54, who is a school guard. They are blessed with four children: Melda, 22, who is attending nursing school; Yufra, seventeen, who is a high school senior; Ningsih, thirteen, who is in junior high school; and Irma, eight, who is in second grade. Indri, five, is not in school yet.

For the past four years Thersia has sold rice. She buys it from farmers and resells it in the market. She felt she could improve her business by purchasing extra rice to sell. She is now applying for a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from TLM to buy ten sacks of rice.

Thersia plans to use her profits to pay education fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of rice.

loans.name: Yeny Estela

texts.es: Yeny, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma. Hace 10 años que Yeny estableció su propio negocio donde confecciona pantalones, faldas, vestidos, y trajes para toda ocasión. Ella ha invertido varios préstamos a su negocio para mantenerlo estable. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 18,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos, encajes, zíper, botones, etc. Para confeccionar ropa y cumplir con los pedidos que le han hecho. También va utilizar parte del préstamo para arreglar el techo a su casa ya que tiene problemas cuando llueve. Su plan es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y lograr establecer el taller en un lugar mejor.
texts.en: Yeny is 33 years old. She is a single mother. She has five children and lives in a village in the township of Choloma. Ten years ago Yeny established her own business, where she makes pants, skirts, dresses, and outfits for every occasion. She has invested a number of loans in her business to keep it stable. Now she is applying for a loan for 18,000 lempiras, with which she is going to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, lace, zippers, buttons, etc, to make clothing and fill the orders that customers have placed with her. She is also going to utilize part of the loan to repair the roof of her house, since she has problems when it rains. Her plan is to continue working to help her children with their studies and to manage to establish the workshop in a better location.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials to make clothing

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina, 47, is married with one child. As her child is currently in school, Edwina works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as cooking oil, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as those she is intending to restock with this loan.

Edwina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as cooking oil, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita, 48, is married and works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her store.

Emelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zorayda

texts.es:
Zorayda, de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia .La actividad que realiza Zorayda es la venta de comida por está razón alquila un establecimiento en donde ofrece los más variados platillos que caracterizan la cocina peruana, prepara los mas exquisitos guisos y otras comidas que se han convertido en los preferidos de sus clientes. La atención diaria empieza a las 7 de la mañana con la preparación de desayuno y culmina cerca de las 3 de la tarde luego de haber vendido diferentes almuerzos. También ofrece bebidas gasificadas, cervezas o jugos de distintos sabores. Lleva en este negocio más de 9 años y en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su hija mayor y solo en casos excepcionales contrata otra persona para ayudarla en la preparación de los alimentos.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es la oportunidad que tiene de trabajar en lo que más le gusta, además de generar sus propios ingresos mediante su fuente de trabajo lo cual le permite cubrir los gastos básicos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos, afortunadamente le va bien y su clientela se mantiene muy fluida.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1300 soles, se siente agradecida de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiera que le permite sentirse segura de continuar trabajando.
Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos que usa diariamentes en la preparación de sus platillos como arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Forty year-old Zorayda is the single mother of two children, aged 17 and 9, with whom she lives in her own home. 

Her business is selling food. To this end she rents out an establishment where she offers various typical Peruvian dishes. She prepares the most delicious stews as well as other foods that have become her customers' favourites.

Service starts daily at 7am with the preparation of breakfast and finishes around 3pm after having sold different lunches. She also offers soft drinks, beers, and a variety of flavours of juice. 

She has been in business for more than 9 years. Her oldest daughter sometimes helps out and only in exceptional cases does she hire someone to help her prepare food.

What she likes most about her job is that it gives her the opportunity to do what she likes best. It also allows her to work to earn her own income, enabling her to cover her household's basic living expenses and meet her children's needs. Fortunately, things have been going well and she has a steady flow of customers.

On this occasion she will be requesting 1300 Peruvian soles. She is thankful to know that she has financial support. It provides a sense of certainty that she will continue to work. 

With the amount she has requested she will buy ingredients and supplies that she uses daily to prepare her dishes such as rice, condiments, meat, oil and other items.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, meat, and condiments among other items.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.es:
Jalia, es una mujer de 45 años, esta casada y tiene de 3 hijos , pero actualmente vive en su casa propia con su pareja y la menor de sus hijos .Jalia, tiene como principal actividad la venta de productos comestibles por está razón ha destinado un  espacio en su vivienda para ofrecer sus productos tales como arroz, azúcar, aceites, huevos, leche, pan, té y otros. De manera frecuente acude al mercado a comprar los productos que pone a la venta gastando gran parte de sus ahorros. En esta actividad trabaja sola y atiende durante todo el día. Lleva en este negocio más de 6 años y afortunadamente desde que empezó no ha sufrido pérdidas económicas considerables. Asimismo, en temporadas de invierno vende pollos, ya que en esta época del año el precio de venta de este producto aumenta y eso la favorece.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su pareja en los gastos básicos de su hogar, además puede manejar su economía de manera organizada y orientada a su futuro, espera más adelante establecer una tienda mas grande y complementarla con nuevos productos.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles , está contenta al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos coméstibles como arroz, azúcar, plátanos y huevos ya que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jalia is a woman of 45. She is married, with three children, and currently lives in her own house with her partner and the youngest of her children.

Jalia's main work is selling groceries and for this reason she has set aside a space in her home to offer products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, eggs, milk, bread, tea and other items. She frequently goes to the market to buy the products she sells, spending a large part of her savings. 

She does this work alone and runs her store all day long. She has been in this business for more than six years, and fortunately, since she began has not suffered significant financial losses. As well, in the winter season she sells chickens, as at this time of year the selling price for this product increases, and that benefits her.

What she likes about her business is that it allows her to have an income with which to help her partner with the basic household expenses. In addition she can manage her finances in an organized way, looking to her future. Later on she hopes to set up a larger store and stock it with new products.

On this occasion she will request 1000 soles. She is happy to know that she will have the financial support to make her plans a reality. With the amount requested she will buy a greater quantity of groceries, such as rice, sugar, plantains and eggs, as they are the products requested most by her customers.
