She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store. She is thankful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, and other staples necessary to stock her store.

loans.name: Ghadiyya

texts.en:
Ghadiyya is 40 years old and lives in Tulkarem. She is married and has two children. She has owned a small grocery store since May 2011.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods for her store. Ghadiyya hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales and improve her income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina de 42 años de edad, es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de Eliazar, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Kelvin y Lizbeth, a los que cuidan en la casa que heredaron desde hace 12 años.
Mientras que su esposo trabaja como peón en una fábrica de ladrillos, donde la pagan por cada millar que realiza. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, pues es ahí donde obtiene mejores ganancias. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de ovejas, toros y vacas muy pequeños, a quienes cuida y alimenta para luego venderlos en las ferias locales de la ciudad, ya tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia. Cuenta que cotiza muy bien sus animales y si no le pagan lo que solicita los regresa a su casa para seguir alimentándolos y así obtener la próxima vez una mejor ganancia ,“no puedo rematar los animales, tengo que ser inteligente”, afirma. Ahora desea junto a su esposo alquilar un terreno amplio para poner su fábrica de ladrillos y así el pueda trabajar en algo propio y no para otras personas.
Aquilina, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de ovejas en cantidad y si el dinero le alcanza en una vaca , a su vez agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para lograr sus objetivos ,además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .
texts.en:
42-year-old Aquilina is a responsible woman.  She lives with Eliazar, her husband of 20 years, and the couple have two children: Kelvin and Lizbeth.  They care for their children in a house that they inherited 12 years ago.

While Aquilina's husband works as a laborer in a brick factory, where they pay him for every 1,000 bricks he makes, Aquilina's business is buying and selling livestock.  This is where they make the most profit.  Aquilina buys sheep, bulls and cows when they are very young, raises and feeds them, then sells them in the local markets in the city.  She has a lot of experience in this line of work.  She says that she charges a very good price for her animals and, if people don't pay her what she asks, she takes the animals home again, continues feeding them, and puts them up for sale again later so that she can make a good profit.  "I can't sell my animals for too little.  I have to be smart", she says.  Aquilina and her husband would like to rent a large plot of land, where they can set up their own brick factory, so that he can work in his own business and no longer have to work for other people.

Aquilina will invest the 2,000 soles she has requested in buying a number of sheep.  If she has enough money left over, she will also buy a cow.  She is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving as it allows her to achieve her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy sheep and a cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 19 year old single man, lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. He is working for a company and he has accumulated his salary in order to provide for his family (brothers and parents). 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorating over the past years. He is requesting a youth loan of 300,000 YER to purchase construction materials for repairing the ceiling and windows. He hopes with this loan the family can live in a more comfortable place. This will also contribute to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing the ceiling and windows in his house.

loans.name: Duo Perlas De Ramirez Group

texts.es:
DUO PERLAS DE RAMIREZ

ESTA FORMADO POR LAS SEÑORA MARTA Y DOÑA SANDRA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL DUO PERLAS DE RAMIREZ  ES CASADA  TIENE DOS HIJAS  MENORES DE EDAD LAS CUALES ASISTEN ALA ESCUELA  ELLA INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 3 AÑOS EL NEGOCIO DE ELLA ES LA VENTA DE TAMALES Y PACHES Y CHUCHITOS Y VENTA DE COSMETICOS ELLA  LE DA PRIMERA MENTE GRACIAS A DIOS POR LA OPORTUNIDAD  QUE  FAPE  LE BRINDO Y  PIDE A FAPE LA PUEDAN SEGUIR APOYANDO  CON SU CREDITO  Y LO QUE MAS LES GUSTA ES LA FORMA DE PAGO Y LOS INTERESES QUE SON BAJOS Y DICEN QUE DIOS BENDIGA A FAPE POR EL APOYO QUE ANTENIDO DE ELLOS
texts.en:
Perlas de Ramirez group.

This group has two members: Marta and Sandra.  Sandra is the group leader.  She is married and has two dependent children who are attending school.  Sandra started her business selling tamales, 'paches' and 'chuchitos' (different types of tamales) and cosmetics three years ago.  Sandra thanks God for the opportunity that FAPE have given her and asks FAPE to continue supporting her with loans.  What she likes most is the repayment terms and the low  interest rates.  She hopes that God will bless FAPE for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is 40 years old and from Samburu. She lives with her husband George and six children. Kasichana has a business selling basic household products such as sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other items, which she supplies to all her neighbors.

She comments that she has many customers and as a result, she can make the income she needs to cover her household expenses and in this way, get ahead in life. She says that her husband helps her in her business as there are days when she has many customers.

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other basic household products with which she can stock her store and offer her customers more variety. Kasichana is very grateful for the help that Yehu Microfinance and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, baked goods and other basic household products.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a humble woman who has made sacrifices. She is a married mother of 10 children who have started their own households. 

Mwaka decided to invest in a small store in her home so that she could provide everything her children need. Her dream is to operate a well-stocked food pantry so that she can offer variety and convenience to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables and other items.

She is happy for the opportunity that Yehu Microfinance has provided. This has helped her achieve part of her long-anticipated dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en:
Glady's is 33 years old and has six children between the ages of 18 and 3 years old. Her husband always helps her with everything in regards to her businesses.

She is a merchant. She started the business by selling food like dumplings and flat bread. After a little while she was stocking up and selling household consumer products such as noodles, sugar, flour and oil. She says that her grocery store has good earnings because she has well-established customers who always frequent her business. With her customers and her husband’s help they are able to support their children and maintain their house.

She is requesting the loan to buy noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat and other basic items in order to stock her place and meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, meat and other basic items.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is from Likoni and has been selling men’s and women’s clothing and accessories from a rented shop for seven years.

She is a client of Yehu Microfinance Trust and has been for more than a year. Thanks to the help she has been receiving, she has been able to improve her business. Her dream is to be able to have her own shop someday, so that she can have a greater income.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Likoni in a rental house with her husband and children. The family raises and sells chickens, and has been in this business for 4 years.

She raises the chickens at her house and sells them by taking them via motorcycle from her home to town as well as to restaurant operators.

The loan is to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo comes from the town of Likoni. She says she runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has 6 children, 2 of whom are adults who are economically independent and four of whom still attend school.

She has been running her small store for many years, and she has established customers and she is really well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. She wants to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 2 years and she has a place in a popular market in Likoni where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

Elnora is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is married to a businessman. They have two children, both of whom attend school.

Mwanamzungu has been working as a street vendor, selling clothes and shoes for women, men, and children since 2011. She has an established clientele.

Mwanamzungu is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students.

loans.use: to purchase of jeans and clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid says that she has been able to help her family through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations. 

Mesaid wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this loan to buy fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kura

texts.en:
Kura lives with her husband and five children in Likoni. At a very young age, she started helping her parents by buying clothing and other products for resale. She has built a very good customer base because of her good pricing and her variety of products. For this reason, she wants to be able to invest in her business.

Kura is requesting this loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments because these are in high demand this season. She is grateful for this opportunity since the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children who are in school. Mariam and her husband do their best to give their children everything they need for their studies so that one day they can become successful and honest people.

Mariam is known as a seamstress. Mariam started out with some capital that she earned while working. Now she has a business where she produces sportswear for educational institutions and sports clubs. Throughout her career, she has gained many customers who visit her home in order to place their orders.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk such as different colored fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies in bulk such as different colored fabrics, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice-farming business.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy works hard to support her family. Mary Joy is married and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Mary Joy has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 37 years-old and married with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm which is a papaya production in order to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 4,000PHP every month. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000PHP in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en: Lilita is 63 years old and separated with three children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a clothing shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 8,000PHP every month. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000PHP in order to purchase additional clothing to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is  49 years old and lives in Jimenez. She provides for the needs of her five children with the 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. For five years this has been an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC and now applies for a micro-finance loan at GDMPC for 7,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Rosalinda also wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 30 years old and married with two children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods and noodles.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Mildred aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Morena works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling charcoal. Morena is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock of bananas to sell for her banana business.

Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es vendedor ambulante de muchas clases de productos, este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y cuenta que gracias a su crédito anterior pude surtirse bien y cumplir con sus clientes, ya que tenia pedidos. Esta muy agradecido, ya que esta saliendo adelante.
Hoy solicita nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de zapatos, prendas, sabanas, edredones y demás, para que así pueda seguir con sus ventas y dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ismael is a street vendor of many products.  This is his second loan with Kiva and he says that thanks to the previous loan he managed to supply himself well and fulfill his customers' orders.  He's very grateful because he's getting ahead.

Today he's requesting another loan to buy shoes, clothing, sheets, quilts, and other merchandise so he can continue selling and giving his customers a good selection.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, sheets, quilts, and other merchandise

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a garden to plant and harvest vegetables for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for gardening. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for gardening.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold, 28 years old, lives with his parents, two siblings and half nephew in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His father has a disability and gets disability pension from the state. His mother has retired from work and gets state pension. His elder brother works as a salesman at a store and his younger brother studies at high school. His brother’s three-year-old daughter also lives with them. 

The house the family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair and expansion. Because his siblings have all reached adult age and everyone has been creating their own family, the house needs more space to accommodate them all. Ariunbold is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiber glass, bricks, cements and planks for building an extension and repairing damaged components of the house, as well as installing a floor heating system into the house. As a result, this extended family can live in a comfortable and warm place.  More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his aged parents.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and install a floor heating system

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for her bakery business.

Myrna has been in this business for five years. Myrna earns more income from a general store.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 50 years old and single. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting papaya to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 10 years and earn 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase chemical supplies for papaya production.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 64 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school. 

Nora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nora requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is 37 years old and married with one child. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over six years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and he has requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Nursuita

texts.en:
Nursuita is 37 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

Nursuita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nursuita requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nursuita has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nursuita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 47 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres, a quienes ama y dedica sus cuidados, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bisutería, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella realiza sus ventas recorriendo las diversas calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, Rosa cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor variedad de bisutería, como aretes, collares, pulseras, etc,. De esta manera Rosa tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents, whom she loves and takes care of.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately Rosa wasn't able to study for a professional career because she lacked the resources and needed to work from a young age.  In her free time she likes to make a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Rosa works in her small business selling costume jewelry.  She works approximately eight hours every day.  She sells her products throughout the different streets in her city.  Rosa believes it's going well for her because of her good prices and friendly customer service.

Rosa's very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a variety of jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc.  this way Rosa will better stock her business and be able to continue working and making the effort to achieve her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dania Veronica

texts.es:
Dania es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a su familia, Dania no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en su ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Dania trabaja en su pequeño negocio donde brinda servicios de impresiones y también vende sellos, Dania trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y facilidades de pago que brinda a sus clientes.
Dania se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos de impresiones y otros relacionados a su labor, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Dania is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She loves her family and they mean the world to her.  Dania is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial resources and the need to work in order to help her family, Dania was unable to study for a degree in Business Administration as she wanted to.  In her free time, she enjoys listening to music and also sometimes cooks delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and determination, Dania set up her own small business providing a printing service.  She also sells stamps.  Dania works every day, from early in the morning, and works for approximately 10 hours.  She believes that her business is doing well owing to her good prices and the payment terms she offers her customers.

Dania is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a computer which will help her a lot in her printing work and other related tasks.  This will enable her to continue working hard and achieve her dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 58 years old and married with four children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle for transport to earn a living. He has been in his business for over eight years and earns 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 59 years old and married.

Purita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Purita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Purita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Purita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, can goods, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 52 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.  

Remegia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  Remegia has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Remegia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emercinda

texts.es: Emercinda, de 47 años, es madre soltera ; pues cuidó sola de sus 2 hijos: Ronal y Franklin , actualmente vive sola en la casa que heredó hace 26 años. Emercinda se dedica a la agricultura y la razón del trabajo arduo que realiza, son sus hijos ,pues ellos realizan sus estudios universitarios en la ciudad de Lima, a donde tiene que mandar una pensión mensual para sus gastos. Todo esto la motiva para continuar su labor diaria , en sus terrenos en donde siembra papa, alverja y maíz, vende sus cosechas integras al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde le pagan un buen precio,además cuida de animales menores como: cerdos, carneros y cuyes, los cuales después de engordarlos los comercializa a los carniceros que llegan a su casa, obteniendo así mejores ganancias. Para el futuro desea continuar con la siembra, pero en mayores cantidades y de buena calidad. Emercinda, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
47-year old Emercinda is a single mother who brought up two children, Ronal and Franklin, by herself. She now lives alone in the house she inherited 26 years ago. She is a farmer and works very hard so that she can support her sons who are at university in Lima. Every month she has to send them money for their expenses. This is the reason she works hard every day.

In her fields Emercinda grows potatoes, peas, and corn. All her harvest is sold in the wholesale market in the town of Tarma where she gets a good price. She also raises animals such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs. After they are fattened, she sells them to the butchers who come to her house and in this way earns more money.

As for the future, Emercinda wants to continue farming and increase production of good quality produce. With the S/. 1000 loan she will buy organic fertilizer to spread on her fields.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the walls of her house to metal sheeting

loans.name: Edith Orbelina

texts.es:
Edith tiene 29 años de edad. Tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos agrícolas; fue su padre quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para preparar el terreno para sembrar maíz. Así, podrá cultivar en mayores cantidades y venderlas después para obtener mejores ingresos y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Edith, 29, has been doing agricultural labor for more than 10 years.  It was her father who taught her.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to prepare the land to plant corn.

This way she'll be able to grow larger quantities and sell the crop to have a better income and continue working.

loans.use: to prepare the land to plant corn

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 40 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Riza has been farming vegetables for six years, and also earns additional income from fishing.

Riza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ruby Ana

texts.en:
Ruby Ana is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, etc.

Ruby Ana has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ruby Ana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, etc.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Adan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Tallarín Rojo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Adan se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de cacao, el cual con ayuda de su esposa dedican diversas labores de campo, Adan trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Adan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del mantenimiento, abono y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Adan podrá lograr que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente y logre una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cosechas y la variedad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Adan is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their two children, who he loves and who are his main reason for living.  He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who along with this wife dedicate all their efforts to getting their family ahead.  Unfortunately Adan was not able to study the professional career of automobile mechanic but he would very much have liked to have been able to do so.  In his free time he likes to cook a very delicious “Tallarín Rojo” (noodles with red sauce) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Adan works in agriculture.  He has a small crop of cacao and with the help of his wife they work at different tasks on the farm.  Adan works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and because of the kind treatment that he gives to others.

Adan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided he will be able to cover maintenance costs, fertilizer and the harvest of his crop.  In this way Adan will be able to get his crops to develop suitably and attain a good sale.  Thus he will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of expanding his harvests and the variety of his crops.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs, fertilizer and the harvest of his crop.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
El Sr. Joel tiene 32 años, vive en pareja actualmente y no tiene hijos. Se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace varios años. Aparte de esta actividad también es docente. Sus ventas las realizan los fines de semana y con estos trabajos ayuda a su pareja.
Joel cuenta que sus ventas las hace por las ciudades como: Asunción, Capiatá e Itauguá en dichas ciudades lleva ropas, calzados, sobrecamas, hamacas, etc. Y las vende. El se define como una persona que desea Salir adelante y crecer.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ropas, calzados, sobrecamas, hamacas ya que está teniendo muy buenas ventas y tiene varios pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old, currently lives together with a partner and doesn’t have children.  He has worked as a street vendor for several years.  Aside from this activity he is also a teacher.  His sales are carried out on the weekends and with these jobs he helps his partner. 

Joel says that he makes his sales around the cities of Asunción, Capiatá and Itauguá.  He takes clothes, shoes, bedspreads, hammocks, etc. to these cities and sells them.  He is defined as a person who wants to get ahead and grow.

The requested loan is for the purchase of clothes, shoes, bedspreads and hammocks as he is having very good sales and has several orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bedspreads and hammocks.

loans.name: Duo Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
CRISTO REY

Este dúo está integrado por las señoras Ingrid e Irma, son originarias de Sumpango, Sac ambas son madres de familia y además cada una tiene un negocio distinto este es el segundo crédito que están solicitando y pagado muy bien en cada cuota, este crédito lo necesitan para poder invertir en tejidos y en compra de telas  ya que siempre tienen varios pedidos. Además agradecen la ayuda de kiva pues les ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia por lo que prometen pagar puntualmente en cada cuota.
texts.en:
Sras. Ingrid and Irma are the two members of the Cristo Rey group. They are from Sumpango, Sacatepequez. Both are mothers and have separate businesses. This is their second loan. They paid off their first one very well. They need this loan to invest in their weaving businesses; they wish to buy yarn since they always have orders to fulfill. 

Ingrid and Irma are grateful for Kiva’s help which has helped their families to get ahead. They promise to make the repayments punctually.

loans.use: buy yarn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew her working capital and buy food products (cassava flour, potatoes) for resale to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
DUO  VISTA HERMOSA


LA SEÑORA DELFINA DE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD Y ALBERTINA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVEN EN PATZUN CHIMALTENANGO  SON HERMANAS  CADA UNA DE ELLAS YA CON SU FAMILIA  , PERO SE DEDICAN  AL NEGOCIO LES GUSTA TRABAJAR  LUCHAR POR SU FAMILIA  YA POR TRES AÑOS  HAN SOLICITADO CREDITO A FAPE  Y ESO LES HA AYUDADO  MUCHO YAQUE  CADA VEZ  QUE SE LES OTORGA SU CREDITO  ELLAS INVIERTEN EN SU NEGOCIO QUE ES TIENDA DE TRAJES TIPICOS  TIENDA DE ARTICULOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO. Y MUCHAS COSITAS MAS .
SUS  SUEÑOS ES DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS QUE ELLOS CRESCAN DARLE ESTUDIO  PARA QUE CUANDO SEAN GRANDES  TENGAN OPORTUNIDADES DE SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Vista Hermosa Group.

Delfina is 34 years old and Albertina is 35.  They both live in Patzun, Chimaltenango.  They are sisters and each has her own family.  They both run a business as they enjoy working and strive to support their families.  They have been taking out loans with FAPE for three years and these loans have helped them a lot.  Every time they receive a loan they invest it their business: a store selling traditional clothing, groceries and many other products. 

Delfina and Albertina aim to provide their children with the best in life.  They want them to receive an education so that they will have more opportunities to make progress in life when they are adults.

loans.use: to buy clothing and basic household goods

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtuya, 53 years old, lives with her son's family in the Kherlen district of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her son has been working at the train station since 2010 and was recently promoted to chief worker. She herself has retired from work and gets a monthly state pension. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, and the roof, particularly, needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as fiberglass, bricks, plates, and planks. After repairing the roof and other parts of the house, the family will be able to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. More importantly, the children and the borrower, who is very old, can live in a warm and comfortable place, not chilled down to their cores in the harsh Mongolian winter climate.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and building materials

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is 59 years old and married, with 6 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for the coconut farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for the coconut farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Erlinda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been pig-fattening for 10 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila manages a school canteen and her home-based store.She has also engaged herself in farming and hog-raising. Prescila is a widow and has four adult children.

Prescila would like to take out for a loan of PHP 40,000 allows her to buy stock of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, snacks, candies, soft drinks and ingredients for her school canteen and home-based store business .She hopes that through this loan amount she can further improve her business, enabling her to earn greater income, educate her grandchildren and improve her way of life.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise such as assorted biscuits, snacks, candies, soft drinks and ingredients for her school canteen and home-based store business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 34 years old and is married. Wilma has two children who are both in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

Wilma has been farming rice for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn offers various kinds of fruits inside the public market of Cordon. She is married to a photographer, and they have been blessed with three children. Two of her children are still studying, while her youngest is still an infant.

Gemmalyn has been managing her fruit vending business for more than five years. According to her, she earns about PHP 3,000 a month. Income gained from her business goes toward their daily necessities, and allowances for her children. She is thankful because through her patience and hard work, she is able to cover their household expenses. Gemmalyn would like to keep her fruit vending business progressive, so she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy boxes of fruits such as apples, lanzones, oranges, and grapes for her fruit vending business. She hopes to get this loan amount in order to send her children on to a higher level of education and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fruits, such as apples, lanzones, oranges, and grapes for her fruit vending business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya is 45 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Erdenjav, age 48, works at a local mining company. Her son Batbileg, age 23, is a university student, while her daughter Bolortuya, age 18, and son Monhbold, age 6, go to local schools. 

Mrs. Narantuya has been working as a saleswoman since 2001. She has gained a lot of experience and many regular customers. She is now starting her own clothing sales business in a rental counter, and she is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business. She is a hardworking, well-experienced and honest woman who says, "Next year my two children will be university students and I need to save for their tuition from now on."

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Yolanda earns more income from dress making. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc. for her general store business. Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina is 45 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. Celerina owns and operates a food selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as pork, beef, chicken and drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as pork, beef, chicken and drinks

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lerma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lerma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, can goods, etc. to sell at her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years. Teresita earns more income from the retail of gasoline and the buying and selling of charcoal.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamjav is 42 years old and lives with his wife and 4 daughters in a ger in the Ih toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tungalag, age 42, helps her husband to run their small grocery store. His daughters Densmaa, age 18, Nansalmaa, age 16, Namuunbileg, age 14 and Nomingoo, age 3 go to local schools and kindergarten. 

Mr. Nyamjav has been running his grocery store with his wife since 2007. He has gained lot of experience in business and built a close relationship with suppliers over the years. He is now planning to create an organic vegetables section in his store and is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables to sell in his store to local customers. He is hardworking, friendly and a positive man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Jumabek

texts.ru: Жумабеку 28 лет. Он женат и у него двое маленьких детей. Жумабек со своей семьей живет в районе Вахш. Он занимается земледелием и в основном выращивает арбуз. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Жумабек обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для приобретения семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений. Он надеется получить богатый урожай. В будущем Жумабек хочет создать свое дехканское хозяйство. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане.
texts.en: Jumabek is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. He and his family live in the Vakhsh region. He grows crops for a living, in particular watermelon. As it is now sowing season, Jumabek is seeking a loan so he can purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer. He is hoping for a very plentiful harvest. In the future, he wants to establish his own "dekhkan" farm, an agricultural system unique to Tajikistan whereby small individual or collective private farms are set up to be worked by a few people, and where the main crops grown are cotton, wheat, or vegetables, which account for 60% of irrigated land use in the country.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ochiroo

texts.en: Mr.Ochiroo is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (or traditional Mongolian tent) in Uvs province. His wife Enhtuya works at home as a cobbler. His daughters Anuhatan, age 5, and Manduuhai, age 3, go to a local kindergarten. The borrower and his wife have been working for a private shoemaker for years while they also run a cobbler service at home. His wife quit recently to go into business on her own as a shoemaker. Mr. Ochiroo is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to buy a large amount of leather and other items to run their business. He and his wife are both hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of leather and other items to run his business.

loans.name: John Rey

texts.en: John Rey is 30 years old, married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business which serves people in the local community. He has been in his business for more than five years and earns 17,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to repair his vehicle so that he can provide better service. His goal for the future is to expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es:
Sara, decide solicitar un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago y porque le genera producción en la siembra de hortalizas. Le servirá para comprar semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, insecticidas y así poder sembrar pipianera.
Con el crédito anterior el efecto que tuvo fue mínimo, porque le genero problemas la seca de agua que impacto al país. Las circunstancias cambiaron en la familia, espera que la esta producción de pipián sea mejor.
texts.en:
Sara decided to request a new loan in order to make it easier to pay for things needed when planting and producing vegetables. She will use the money to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides so that she can plant pipian.

Her previous loan had minimal impact because of the overall impact of drought throughout the country. These circumstances changed her family, so she hopes that this production of pipian will be better.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: DON FREDY ES ORIGINARIO DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y ES PROPIETARIO DE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO EL CUAL ES MUY FRECUNTADO POR SUS VECINOS Y MUCHOS NIÑOS YA QUE ESTA UBICADA EN CERCANIA DE UNA ESCUELA. DON FREDY  ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE. EL SUEÑO DE DON FREDY ES SURTIR MAS SU TIENDA PARA PODER OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES PRODUCTOS SURTIDOS Y DE BUENA CALIDAD. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE AZUCAR, JUGOS GASEOSAS Y PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECECIDAD
texts.en:
Don Fredy is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is the owner of a general store that is frequented by his neighbors and several children who attend a school nearby. Don Fredy is a friendly individual. His dream is to restock his store with more products so that he can offer his customers available items that are of good quality.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar, juices, sodas, and basic necessity products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, juices, sodas, and basic necessity products.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 57 años es una mujer trabajadora. Enviudó hace 8 años, tubo 6 hijos, pero ahora solo vive con su hijo Antony y su nieta Adriana, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 38 años. 
Desde hace 5 años emprendió el negocio de crianza de cerdos, posee 10 ejemplares todos robustos y de buena raza, “Los crío en campo abierto como son grandes no los puedo tener en mi casa, además de esa manera crecen más sanos y robustos”, afirma. Cuando tiene gordos a sus animales los comercializa en carne o vivos, “todo depende de los clientes”, menciona Doña Marcelina. Asimismo desea construir un espacio más acogedor para sus animales por lo que ya está pensando en mejorar el establo. Ahora desea engordar numerosos ejemplares, pues ya tiene pedidos para la festividad del día de la madre.
Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero ya que podrá lograr sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Marcelina, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus cerdos.
texts.en:
57-year-old Marcelina is a hard-working woman.  She became a widow eight years ago and has six children.  She currently lives with her son Antony and her granddaughter Adriana who she cares for in the house that she bought 38 years ago.

Five years ago, Marcelina set up a business raising pigs.  She has 10 animals which are all healthy and a good breed.  "I raise them in the open fields.  I can't raise them at home because they are too large.  Anyway, they grow healthier and stronger that way", she says.  When Marcelina's animals have grown, she sells them either alive or as meat: "It all depends on the customer", she says.  Marcelina would like to create a better space for her animals and so she is planning to improve her barn.  She would like to fatten a number of animals as she already has orders for Mothers' Day.

This is Marcelina's first loan from Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support as it will enable her to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  Marcelina will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying nutritionally-balanced feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced pig feed

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 54 años de edad ,vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo Eduardo en la casa que compraron hace 10 años. Su esposo es contador de profesión, juntos abrieron un estudio contable, donde brinda sus servicios , a pesar de no haber estudiado para el ejercicio, sabe mucho del tema, pues ayuda a su esposo en lo que pueda pero Nancy se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y productos de librería, en un espacio que acondicionaron al costado de la tienda. Ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a ello, no cuenta con un lugar propio, pues alquila la oficina y tienda, que se encuentran en un lugar céntrico y estratégico para poder desarrollar su negocio en todo este tiempo. Además de confiar en su hijo, quien quiere estudiar la misma carrera de su padre, como es una mujer empeñosa y muy segura de sí misma, sabe que podrá trabajar y orientar a su hijo a estudiar una carrera profesional que le ayude en el futuro . Nancy invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de productos para su librería tales como hojas bond, cuadernos , lapiceros , entre otros ya que desea tener lo necesario para sus clientes .
texts.en:
Nancy, 54, lives together with her husband and her son Eduardo in a house they bought ten years ago. Her husband works as an accountant. They both opened an office offering accounting services, and even if she did not study accounting, she knows a lot about it and helps her husband as much as she can.

Nancy sells office supplies and stationery in a space they set up next to the office. She has been doing this for sixteen years now, renting a space in a central and strategic location. Nancy trusts her son, who wants to follow his father’s steps. Since she is a hardworking and confident woman, she knows that she will be able to work and influence her son to make a good decision for his future.

Nancy will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in buying stationery items, such as paper sheets, notebooks, pens and other supplies in order to have what her customers need.

loans.use: to buy stationery items such as paper sheets, pens and notebooks.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, solicita un crédito por la necesidad de surtir más la tienda con productos nuevos, agregar más pedidos por la temporada. Este le permitirá comprar más  galletas, pan, gaseosas y otro tipo de bebidas, productos de la canasta básica.
El préstamo anterior le permitió  realizar compras de los productos necesarios para la tienda y aportar para su familia. Las condiciones del hogar han mejorado y su deseo es comprar su casa para que puedan tener una mejor estabilidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan because she needs to add new products to the inventory of her store, thus generating more orders this season. The money will allow her to buy more cookies, bread, sodas, other types of beverages, and basic household products.

Her previous loan enabled her to buy necessary products for her store so that she could provide for her family. The conditions of her home have improved and her wish is to buy a house so that they will have better stability.

loans.use: to buy more cookies, bread, sodas, other types of beverages, and basic household products.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cristo Rey está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité donde todas se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Ellas tienen gran esperanza de mejorar sus vidas es por eso que se unieron para mejorar.
Dominga es una de las miembros, quien con mucho esfuerzo ayuda a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz que ella misma procesa, es un trabajo duro, pero lo hace con mucho entusiasmo ya que mediante eso su familia tiene un sustento.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de maíz, para poder procesarlo y seguir con sus ventas. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y lo demuestra día a día.
texts.en:
The communal bank Cristo Rey is in its third loan cycle with the program, and its members are striving to get ahead. The women have great hopes of improving their lives and have come together to reach this goal. 

Dominga, one of the members, works hard to help her family. She sells corn flour that she produces, a difficult job, but one she does enthusiastically because it provides income for her family. She has applied for a loan to buy corn to process and sell. She wants to grow and shows it day after day.

loans.use: to buy whole corn to make corn flour to sell.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умеду 29 лет. Он женатый человек. Умед живет в районе Вахш. Умед в течение трех лет работал экономистом. Последние 5 лет он занимается животноводством. Он покупает крупнорогатый скот, откармливает его несколько месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль Умед запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Umed is 29 years old and married. He lives in the Vakhsh region. For the past 3 years, he has been working as an economist, and for the last 5 years, he has been raising cattle. He buys livestock, fattens them for a few months, then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. Umed is seeking a loan so he can expand his business and earn a good profit through the purchase and sale of more cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Sumber Kelapa Group

texts.en: The members of the Sumber Kelapa group are requesting a loan to buy supplies for their various businesses. Some will also use a portion of the loan to buy merchandise to sell in their small kiosks. Hasunah, who leads the group, will use her portion to buy raw materials such as wood and coconut shells.  She hopes she can finish her craft orders on time and that she can use her profits to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 60, a widow, and lives in Silang, Cavite Philippines. She earns a living by running a transportation business. She rents her vehicle to drivers who use it to carry up to four passengers at a time, and then share their earnings with her. She makes a minimum of PHP 500 every day. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income from the loan. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Erdenetuul

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetuul is 40 years old, supporting her two daughters in the Govi-altai province of Mongolia. Her daughters, Oyuntogm (age 16) and Demberel (age 15) go to the local secondary school. Mrs. Erdenetuul has been running a tailoring service at her home since 2007. She has built close relationships with her regular customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory. She is a hardworking, strong woman who says, "My daughters will soon be university students and I have tuition fees to pay in the near future, so I need to work even harder."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Eufrosina

texts.es: Eufrosina tiene 65 años de edad y habita de  Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde tiene el negocio de alquilar motocicletas, actividad que hace 5 años inició, cuando observó que se incrementaron el número de estos vehículos en esta población. Sus principales clientes son los propietarios de motocicletas que ofrecen el servicio de transporte en Arjona, a quienes   les ofrece el servicio de lavado y engrase desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. En la actualidad ha recibido 1 financiamiento  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logró incrementar el número de sus clientes y hoy quieren comprar 2 lavadoras más; pero como  su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cubrir esta expectativa, está aplicando a un crédikiva, mediante el cual  comprará los equipos de trabajos que   requiere, pues su meta es continuar incrementando sus ingresos y ordenar sus cuentas para controlar efectivamente su negocio.  Eufrosina cuenta con 2 trabajadores que lavan las motocicletas y ganan el 50% de la utilidad que se produce diariamente.
texts.en:
Eufrosina, 65, lives in Arjona, a city in Bolívar department, where she runs a motorcycle rental service. She started the business five years ago when she noticed that the numbers of motorcycles in the area had increased. Her main clients are motorcycle owners who offer transport service in Arjona. She offers them wash and wax service form 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

She previously received a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which helped her increase her client base. She now wants to buy two more washing machines, but she lacks the capital to do so. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy the equipment she needs to meet her goal to increase her income, to balance the accounts, and to effectively manage the business. Eufrosina employs two people to wash the motorcycles, and they earn 50% of the profit they produce daily.

loans.use: to buy two motorcycle washers.

loans.name: Islomidin

texts.ru: Исломидин житель района А.Джоми. Ему 58 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Его сыновья находятся на заработках за пределами страны. У Исломидина среднее техническое образование. Он работал шофером в течение 20 лет. Одновременно все эти годы он занимался животноводством. Сейчас Исломидин запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en: Islomidin lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 58 years old, married, and has 4 children. His sons are migrant workers in a foreign country. Islomidin has a vocational high school education. He worked as a driver for 20 years, and during all those years, he also raised livestock. He is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle. He wants to use the profit generated by this loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
This is Merla. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but even in her family. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store. She has been in this business for five years. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merla dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her children will all have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. At these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
This is Dante. He previously took a 19,000 PHP loan to purchase larger amounts and a greater variety of the grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help towards their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Dante would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Dante dreams that his variety store will be a grocery store. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. At these meetings he draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Tsagaanhuu

texts.en: Mrs.Tsagaanhuu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Borgih, helped his wife to start her own butcher shop. Her sons, Batbold, age 17 and Battuvshin, age 7, go to local schools. Mrs.Tsagaanhuu worked in South Korea until 2010 with her husband as a contract worker. She has run a small grocery store, and ran an animal pelt and meat trading business from 1994 to 2008. She has a lot of experience in business. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products for her butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothes and sweaters for a thread-making business

loans.name: Nancy Josefina

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 53 años, con su preparación en la escuela secundaria ha podido salir adelante y sustentar las necesidades de su hogar, es divorciada lo cual fue una crisis muy difícil en su vida, pero que supo sobrellevar exitosamente. Tiene 4 hijos que son independientes y tienen su hogar formado bajo los mismos valores que aprendieron con su valiosa madre. Ahora Nancy vive sola en la Parroquia Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Nancy es una mujer comerciante, ha aprendido del negocio y sus finanzas empíricamente, pues lleva 10 años vendiendo cosméticos, joyas y ropa de forma ambulante, recorre las largas calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, tomando pedidos y cobrando las cuentas pendientes de sus clientes. Invierte todo el día en esta actividad, saliendo desde tempranas horas en la mañana y volviendo a su hogar un poco después del atardecer. Nancy solicita un préstamo con el cual podrá comprar pantalones de calidad para ofrecerlos a precios cómodos en el sur de Quinindé una zona rural que Nancy ha tenido la oportunidad de visitar para ofrecer sus productos y en la cual identificó la demanda de ropa casual principalmente pantalones de este tipo. Es su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa y fue muy oportuno por la agilidad, confianza y apertura que prestan a emprendedores y microempresarios que trabajan en busca de la obtención de sus sueños. Nancy sueña con tener su negocio propio establecido en la ciudad para evitar el traslado que afecta su salud por el ajetreo y a veces las condiciones climáticas que no se prestan para su recorrido acostumbrado. 
Nancy agradece a quienes alrededor del mundo se preocupan por financiar este sueño y ser parte del crecimiento de su negocio a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Nancy, 53, has been able to get ahead and cover her family’s needs with her high school education. She got divorced, which was a difficult period of her life, but she has managed to overcome it. Nancy has four independent children that have their own families and kept the values they learned from their mother, a valuable person. 

Nancy lives now by herself in a community called Chigüilpe, 15 minutes away from Santo Domingo’s center. Santo Domingo is the capital city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, a region with many commercial activities that has become an important hub for the exchange between the mountains and the coastal areas in Ecuador.

The Chigüilpe community has different houses; some built with cement, some with wood and cement combined. It has a river that is popular with tourists and where people practice different sports. They also have the opportunity to see and learn from the tsáchila culture, by listening to stories and legends by a bonfire or while camping. Santo Domingo is the third most inhabited city in the region and has other activities such as agriculture, cattle farming, fishing and manufacture.

Nancy is a saleswoman who has learned by doing. She has been selling cosmetics, jewelry and clothes as a street vendor for ten years. She walks the city’s streets offering her products and receiving orders and collecting money from her customers. Nancy works all day, starting early in the morning and coming back home in the evening. She is requesting a loan to buy good-quality pants to sell them south of Quinindé, a rural area that she has visited and where she identified a good opportunity to sell clothes, especially this type of pants. This is her first loan with Fundación Alternativa. The process was fast, thanks to their confidence and open-mindedness with entrepreneurs that work to meet their goals.

Nancy dreams of having her own, fixed establishment in the city. In this way, she does not have to travel and put her health at risk because of the weather and the energy that is required. Nancy wants to thank those who, all over the world, care about financing this dream and that contribute to the growth of her business through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy good-quality pants to sell in rural areas.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La Señora Magda es de la Ciudad de Concepción en donde tiene su negocio, ella es comerciante hace 4 años  cuenta con clientes tanto  en la ciudad de Concepción y alrededores, también cuenta con ventas de ropas, mercería ,comestibles ,y tiene el servicio de maxi y mini carga como ventas de tarjetas y demás accesorios de celulares entre otros, comenzó con venta de comestibles donde con el día a día fue cargando su local en donde hoy cuenta con buena cantidad de productos para su venta 
Desea que con el tiempo pueda llegar a cumplir su sueño de ser dueña de una casa comercial en donde pueda vender variedades de cosas  por lo que trabaja duro 
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas y tarjetas para poder reponer lo que ya vendió. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Magda lives in Concepción, where she has a business. She has been a merchant for four years and has clients in Concepción and the surrounding areas. She sells clothing, notions, food items, and prepaid cellular cards and accessories. She began by selling food and gradually added more stock, and today she offers a broad selection.

She is working hard to achieve her dream of owning a larger store where she could sell a variety of things. She has applied for a loan to buy clothing and cards to replenish her inventory. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cards to sell.

loans.name: Khujaqul

texts.ru: Хучакул житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 42 года. У него жена и трое детей. Один его сын работает за пределами страны. Сам Хучакул вместе с женой работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Сейчас Хучакул хочет начать свой бизнес и для этого выбрал животноводство, так как это прибыльное дело и не требует тяжелой работы. С этой целью Хучакул запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khujaqul lives in the Shahrituz region in the south-western part of Tajikistan. He is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. One of his sons is currently working abroad. Khujaqul and his wife work in the "dekhkan" farming sector, which is an agricultural system unique to Tajikistan whereby small individual or collective private farms are set up to be worked by a few people, and where the main crops grown are cotton, wheat, or vegetables, accounting for 60% of irrigated land use in the country. Now Khujaqul wants to start his own business in the area of animal husbandry because this field is profitable and does not require a great deal of physical labour. With this aim in mind, he is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads, thread, etc. for decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
This is Hermosa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the gardening materials that she needed, thus generating more income. She has been in this business for six years. As a single woman, she works hard for her daily needs and to help her relatives as well.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets, seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hermosa dreams that her business will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
